Reviews.Title: “"Sunny" Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Thom L
Reviews.Content: Needed to get away from cold weather. Upon arriving in sunny San Diego, I gave the hotel a call (be sure to keep the phone number handy), and the free airport shuttle was dispatched. The driver was very courteous and knowledgable. The person running the front desk asked me about my room preference ... I wanted it quiet, so he gave me a room on the third floor away from the current street maintenance. I found my room and went to the pool ... well kept with plenty of lounges. Upon returning to my room, I asked for a room change to be closer to the pool and still on the quiet third floor. The front desk was very gracious and accommodating, and I had in the blink of an eye, a room to my liking ... far from the street and close to the pool. I didn't see any free popcorn, but there was coffee, TV (with HBO), microwave, refrigerator, hair dryer, iron w/board, beach towels, and a room safe. The office lobby also had free internet and WiFi. This was certainly nice when I checked out as I was able to download and print my boarding pass. I went to the zoo. A free shuttle to and from was provided. Actually, the hotel provides free to and from shuttle to all the local attractions. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel, but I walked the short distance (perhaps 4 - 5 blocks) to the trolley station and easily accessed downtown. In fact, the "Blue Line" goes all the way to Tijuana. The cost was $2.50 each ride, or $5.00 for an all day pass ...a great deal! The other review didn't care for Bunz (hamburger/hot dog restaurant on the property). I ate there twice. The prices were reasonable and the food was good. Although I had a late departure, they let me hang out in the room for two hours past check-out. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: AnnArborMiBob
Reviews.Content: This place advertises itself as the highest rated Days property in San Diego, and it is easy to see why. The room was big, had a decent desk at which I got much work done, also had a small round table surrounded by two cushioned chairs, had a relatively new refrigerator and microwave, and all of it worked! (That included the drain plug mechanisms in both the bathtub and sink, which I've had trouble with in far ritzier hotels.) The folks who run this place are taking care of it. The free microwave popcorn, granola bar, and bottle of water (replenished daily) were another nice touch. And the rate I received (with my AARP discount) was spectacular. My business had originally booked me at a Hilton about 0.6 miles east, for about 2.5 times the rate, and I don't really feel like I missed much. (And the Hilton would almost certainly have charged me for parking and Internet, while this Days Inn did not, and the wireless connection was a quite reliable five-bar signal.) I'm perhaps stretching a bit to find things to gripe about, but here are a few: The window heating/cooling unit was a bit cranky, requiring some experimentation to get the temperature right, but once I did it stayed right. Also, I arrived before check-in time and discovered that my luggage was going to be stored in a room that was indeed locked, but that the routine for retrieving it was that the staff unlocked it and I found and removed what was mine myself; that made me a little nervous. Also, I do *not* recommend the new in-hotel restaurant, Bunz (which is not actually run by the hotel, but only renting space from it) - The Amigo Spot in the Kings Inn to the west, and the Seven Seas restaurant a few doors to the east, are both better choices. But all in all, the experience was at least as good as one would expect in a hotel somewhat more upscale than those in the price range of this chain. I will stay here when I come back to San Diego next year, and again forego that Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great value!”
Reviews.Author: LaurieAnn70
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, staff was polite, pool and hottub was very nice and the free shuttle service was great! Very accommodating and helpful! Would definately stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: gigirl443
Reviews.Content: Easy check in. Location close to what we had planned for the week. Our room was towrds the front, but the only sounds we heard were the water pipes of the neighboring rooms. It was clean, We saw the housekeepers' laundry bins with bedspreads along with the usual laundry. We added an extra night to our trip, and the desk clerk discounted it for us. The room had a small fridge, microwave, and a tv. The pool was heated during our stay, and the hot tub was nice. Overall a nice stay. Would probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rate and clean room = OK stay”
Reviews.Author: napavalleywino
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy. Great location for easy on/off highway. You can hear the people upstairs walking around and it sounds like a hippopotamus is about ready to come through the roof and I don't think they really were that heavy. Plus there was a noise every time somebody walked above that sounded like there was a loose metal rod or plate that sqweeked. Bed was comfortable with lots of pillow options. Rooms looked to have been recently updated but the drywall was the original. Just painted and warped/patched in a couple of areas. High Def TV. Coffee maker, mini fridge, microwave and mini safe in rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Room Smell Overwhelming”
Reviews.Author: TMTATravel
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was excited about our choice, but walking into the room, I was overwhelmed by the cleaning product smell, akin to cheap shoe polish. The room seemed darker than pictures here and kind of musty. The smell was so overwhelming we moved the next day to the Best Western - Seven Seas 2 doors down and were much happier overall. Days Hotel did have better internet service, microwaves in the room, better shuttle schedules, and information of local resources. We also liked Bunz, but staff seemed overworked. Pool area was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Loud housekeepers”
Reviews.Author: brupm
Reviews.Content: Housekeepers are really loud at 8:30am with their carts right next to your rooms's window. Hotel is acceptable other than that.

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrea h
Reviews.Content: I was rather hesitant to book this hotel after reading some of the reviews, not that they were bad but some people were complaining about things. First, it was nicer than I expected (first got there and expected a crappy motel, from the looks on the outside), but it was a lot nicer in the rooms (as it should because i paid 99 bucks for the night). The rooms were clean, the beds were comfy, and it was quiet. The staff was super nice and we even had housekeeping knock on our door even though we were going to be checking out at noon. Very convenient location, close to a lot of things and the free shuttle to sea world and back was awesome! saved a lot on parking, and even left our car at the hotel to go to sea world after we checked out! parking at the hotel was free, which was nice! no free breakfast tho, so we had to go to the little restaurant they have, Bunz, which wasn't bad. I asked for a king bed and i was given 2 queens, but it was no problem. Good for a one night stay in SD, def will come back!

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Introduction to The USA, and San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Neata_Skeeter
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we stayed on our recent trip to the States, and we loved every minute in San Diego. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful, and we were quite impressed with our room. The bed was very comfy and the bathroom was clean and in great working order. We had awesome experiences with the shuttle drivers, too. They were so friendly and had loads of info to share about the city as they drove us to our tourist destinations (Sea World, SD Zoo). On our last day, they had some difficulties with one of the shuttle buses and were running behind schedule, and some other guests were really rude and abusive about it, but the driver that finally turned up handled the situation really well, staying calm and friendly despite the attitude he received. The restaurant at the hotel was great! We had dinner on our first night and were pleased with the quality and quantity of the food, and had a wonderful, satisfying breakfast every morning. The staff there were also very friendly and willing to accommodate any requests or changes to our meals. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The price was right for the short visit”
Reviews.Author: Dubaychris
Reviews.Content: We were visiting our daughter at SDSU for an event she was having. I booked this Hotel through a vacation package with Orbitz. The price was right. The Hotel was fair/good. I felt like we were in the ditch though. The highway was right next to the hotel, the hotel was on a side street and the access on and off was not user friendly. The restaurant was okay. The service was very slow. The people at the front desk of the hotel were not friendly at all, they were very rude. My daughter and I were at the pool and a rat ran across the fence. Parking is short here, it seemed as though we were always fighting for a spot.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend.”
Reviews.Author: MexicoMadness
Reviews.Content: Our second stay in 2 years. If by car, well located. Clean and well priced. We stayed on this occasion in the Sunset wing......a bit more expensive but better bedding and very, very quiet. Free Wi-fi and shuttle availability is always a major plus.May I add San Diego is a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Super Value, Super Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: DeanW2011
Reviews.Content: This was our second pre cruise stay at this hotel within the last three years. This alone says a lot because of the shear amount of hotels in this area. We returned a second time because of the value, clean rooms and overall appearance of this property. The free shuttle to the pier was a big plus as well as free shuttle to/from the airport (although both times we arrived late at night after the shuttle had stopped running) When we take our next cruise out of San Diego you bet we will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Will continute to return”
Reviews.Author: Hourglassman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel while attending a conference in San Diego 4 different times since 2005 because each time my room has been both clean and comfortable with the added benefit of an excellent internet connection included in the price. I expect to return again in 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it; especially if you have a family”
Reviews.Author: Mary C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Days Hotel the first week of January. I did a lot of research to find one that would best fit our family; we have two small children. I chose Days because of the free shuttle; and I am very pleased with our choice. The shuttle was there promptly and took us to the zoo and Sea World. We saved a lot in parking costs. We did the hike and bike package and got snacks and water for the kids; for the same advertised price as a regular room online. The kids--and husband; really--enjoyed the fruit snacks and pretzels. The room was clean; quiet and was really all we were looking for. The management was very kind and let us check in late and leave our car late. The only issue was having the Lost and Found office not call us for a whole week; after three calls; to get our forgotten shoes sent back to us. But we got them eventually! We stayed the beginning of our vacation at Paradise Point and we were happier here. For the money; we had a great time. I know that others complained about noise and parking; we didn't have either of those problems. We would definitely stay again; and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE!!”
Reviews.Author: bella2130
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at hotel we used the shuttle, tipped the driver only To have our bags dumped out of the bus in the car park. Got to our rooms, which we thought were nice enough only to find someone else's hair in the bed. It Is right beside the freeway so heard sirens all throughout the night. Booked the shuttle the next morning, and when we came down having made 2 trips with our bags, we were told it had already left, The receptionist was rude and told us we would be waiting another 2 hours for the next shuttle!! Had to remind her it was stated by the driver that it can be booked at any time on request! Will definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Manager”
Reviews.Author: travelinmom56
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our visit and I truely can't say enough good about this hotel and especially the managment there. We got a really great rate so we booked there and shortly after our booking I got an e-mail from the hotel offering to help us plan our stay there with all kind of suggestions. I replied to the e-mail asking for information about some discount we were looking for and received apersonal message back and asking if there was anything else I needed. We had to arrive very late but that was not a problem at all. Our rooms were always very clean. The shuttle service was a very nice bonus. We were having a wonderful time there when I got an emergency message that I needed to come home at once. It was around six or so in the evening and the manager was very understanding and gave us half off of our rooms We would definately stay at this hotel again and highly reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, value, semi-luxury”
Reviews.Author: mikesurfer
Reviews.Content: I'm starting to think that in regard to reasonably priced San Diego hotels, the key question is whether one is a morning person--the kind of person for whom a complimentary breakfast is an important perk. This Days Inn does not offer any sort of breakfast, so if heavy start to your day is important to you, then you may not like this ppty. The advantage of sacrificing breakfast is all you receive in its pl;ace--larger than usual room in this price range (with even an interesting piece of modern art on the wall), a refrig, a micro- wave, a great heat pump unit for comfy climate in the room, nice furnishings, a computer for guest use in the lobby, and, wow, an absolutely smashing pool and spa surrounded by lush greenery at the rear of the ppty--very zen pool area. The pillows are a bit tired, but the king size bed is a real king size, not an exaggeration. Friendly front desk staff. I came for business, but the shuttle sevice can be a big help so check into that too.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, clean, good location, and kitchenette included”
Reviews.Author: RachelW1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in January 2012 and we had a great experience. We rented 2 rooms and both were clean and well-maintained. The rooms are not huge, but are large enough to be comfortable. An added bonus was that the rooms had kitchenettes with dishes, a microwave, a kitchen sink, as well as a separate bathroom sink, and a mini-refrigerator. We ended up going to a nearby store and buying food to make for breakfast so we didn't have to have as much fast food while traveling. The hotel is close to Sea World, Old Town San Diego, the mall, and trolley stations, so it was really convenient. The only complaint I had about the hotel was that the parking lot fills up quickly and it was difficult to find a parking spot at the end of the night. Also, the parking spots that are available are fairly narrow and there is limited room to back out of the spots. Other than that, we had an amazing stay and I would definitely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Experience”
Reviews.Author: Anne S
Reviews.Content: Overall is quite good according to the low price range. It provides shuttle service for Sea World and the Zoo other than taking us to the airport. Room was relatively clean. Most front desk clerks were okay but one was exceptionally good (I think his name is Steve). The drivers were pretty nice and one was very good and thoughtful (Ethan). If you have a limited budget (in order to spend more on other stuff ^^ ), I would recommend this hotel to you.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to boast about.”
Reviews.Author: scanlessfool
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night back in July of 2011. It was by no means terrible or bad, but average. The room was nice and I was pretty happy with the layout of the restroom. The room also came with a fridge which was extremely convenient since we had a lot of food stored in an ice chest from the day we spent at Sea World. Upon reading reviews I was informed to ask for a room in the back, which I did. I can't compare it to the rooms in the other buildings, but I did like being in the back near the pool as it felt a bit more private, almost like an apartment complex. I especially liked being able to use the covered parking. Disappointment: One thing I had been especially looking forward to was breakfast, which was supposed to be provided in the pool area, but when we asked the woman at the front desk she had said that was no longer available. It was not a big deal, but I really had my mind set on some muffins or orange juice. Tip: Being that I was sharing a room with the family we went to Sea World with, we only received one parking pass. If you want another parking pass, the hotel requires you to pay an amount which I can't remember. Rather then doing that, I just opened the lid of a trash can and found a parking pass that someone had thrown away. Call it what you will, but I didn't want to spend anymore money here. Overall: As I had mentioned and there was nothing to blow me away. I believe though that I extremely overpaid for this room though. My amount was $150.98 when the room was anywhere between a $50-75/night room. It's just my opinion. Would I stay here again: No, not at the price listed above. If it was at the price I believe it should be, I'd give it some thought.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great comfort, great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Joan R
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay, and I think there had been renovations and improvements since 3 1/2 years ago. Absolutely no complaints and great bargain booked through the Southwest airlines website. No breakfast included but the mini fridge allows budget dining and there are many close by breakfasts available.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: elizabethknc
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our recent stay at Days Hotel. Our rooms far exceeded our expectations and was a killer deal for the $58/night that we paid. The rooms appeared ot have been recently renovated and were really clean. Our beds were almost like "Westin beds", big pillowtops with fluffy pillows. Check in was fine and thanks to an employee named Tiffany who went out of her way to answer my questions prior to my making our reservation. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best quality/price ratio I've ever met”
Reviews.Author: YuMCH
Reviews.Content: As I remember I paid around $40 for room in the hotel. It's the best quality/price ratio I've ever met for hotels. Quality of rooms are outstanding for such a price. They are quite clean, well quipped and quite at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for the budget-minded”
Reviews.Author: bulldogspikesmom
Reviews.Content: An unpretentious "hotel"(really a motel), the Days Hotel offers an excellent value for the budget-minded traveler. Our rooms were not huge but each one contained a small fridge and microwave and an in-room safe. A kitchenette unit also has a small cooktop and a selection of pots, dishes, glasses and flatware. At the northern end of Hotel Circle, it is easy to get to and only minutes from Sea World, the San Diego Zoo and the waterfront. The hotel has a small coffee shop offering reasonably priced meals (we ate breakfast there every morning and found the food to be very well prepared and served by friendly, accommodating servers) and children's menus. There is an outdoor heated swimming pool and hot tub at the back of the property and the maids leave pool towels in your room. There is also a free shuttle to and from the airport, Sea World and the Zoo. All this would be good enough, given the extremely reasonable price of the rooms, but the beds are EXCELLENT. I was expecting beds of average quality, but these were way beyond anything I hoped for. In fact, they could easily compete with the wonderful beds at the Hilton Universal in LA, which are the best I've ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Stranded”
Reviews.Author: Shebewoman
Reviews.Content: Unless you rent a car, this is not the Hotel to stay at. There is no mini mart store within walking distance nor a restaurant other than the one on site. It is more like a MOTEL than a Hotel that they call it.

Reviews.Title: “better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Lorenia A
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I had no time to look for more and it was only one night, for the price I paid I was worried about getting something horrible but I was really surprised as first of all the service was really good, my room was in a second floor and as I had many bags I was kind of mad but there was an elevator which I did not expect and the room was perfect. It smelled when I first entered, like kind of old rug smell but as I entered the room I guess it went away or it just did not bother me anymore. The shower was really clean and nice and the beds are very comfortable. They seem really clean too so I guess my stay was perfect for the price I paid. I really recommend it if you, like me, are just spending ONE night and you are using the hotel for sleeping. I arrived late at night and had to leave early for the airport so it was great. The location for me was perfect as I needed something in the area for shopping in fashion valley and westfield mall and I rented a car so I did not want to stay in a hotel and pay a lot for parking the car.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: mainec00ncat
Reviews.Content: Everyone was really nice at the hotel, we did not have any problems. Parking is a problem though. Although you are to put a sign in the front of your car or your car will be towed, they do not monitor this. We were there Thanksgiving week and a few times had to park on the opposite end of our room location, just walking back I counted 6 cars that did not have their sign in the front. Granted some of them might have forgot, but when you are coming back from being gone most of the day and have lots of packages it was a pain. I felt safe all the time, we were out numerous evenings after dark not a problems. We used the laundry room was very nice they even had a TV in there. Although it was warm enough we were too busy and did not use the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Gross!”
Reviews.Author: Deniz A
Reviews.Content: Don't do it! Very simple. I do not have high expectations. Just want a clean room nice staff. Did not get either. To sum it up $700 got me a molded room (mold on ceiling), smells of mold so immense when walking in the room I couldn't breathe. When I woke up to a box of used lube,dvd's and toys dwn the hall, I knew it was time to go. Finshed my stay at another hotel to say the least. I paid in total $1200 for my hotels for one week. I believe it is a scam to be rude and have disgusting rooms! DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL! (can't imagine worse customer service)+ motel itself not great and many better alternatives!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth B
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I NEVER write reviews - that's how terrible this experience was. The motel itself is overall disappointing (my room was way in the back of a parking lot- and in all honesty I didn't feel tremendously safe hiking over there at night)- the carpet/tv etc was "fine"- and I wasn't really expecting much. This review however is because this was literally the WORST customer service I've ever experienced. I was traveling for an interview at UCSD- and they have a shuttle that goes up the hill. When I asked the front desk about it- they replied that I could just call 15 minutes before and that would be adequate. I called them at 7am on a Saturday (presumably a time when the shuttle wasn't probably too busy)- it was POURING rain actually- and I just called to "inquire" if there were anyway that the shuttle could come around to the back- about 100 feet- but given my suit + suitcase etc it would have made a big difference given the rain. The first guy told me he would check and I should call back in 5 minutes. When I called back- the lady on the phone told me "she didn't think it could work"- but when prompted she agreed to just ask- because it was POURING- and I don't see how it made much difference at all for the shuttle driver (literally on the way out of the parking lot)-- especially given that they had said I was the only passenger so far. Then some other lady- named "Joy" came on the phone and asked "what my problem was" -- and that now the shuttle had other people to take and it needed to leave immediately. I replied that I would run over there that second- and although she said "ok"- when I got there (soaking wet)- the shuttle had just left. Furthermore Joy and the other lady told me to be "patient" while I was waiting there soaking wet for a shuttle I had called about 30 minutes before. Like I said- I've never been motivated to write a complaint- I think it's ok to ask for something politely that would make a big difference in pouring rain- but I didn't act insulting about the question-- and I felt they went out of their way to be difficult and insulting. Another person interviewing with me had a similiar experience with them trying to arrange the shuttle. Anyway- they are grouped with at least 10 other cheap hotels- their price I'm sure is not so much cheaper to warrant this degree of poor service. I would definitely look at any of the other motels in the vicinity- because although you might not expect much from a motel like this-- it's reasonable to expect them to at least try to be nice (or have some BASIC service skills).

Reviews.Title: “Only OK...”
Reviews.Author: KarenBeachcomber
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in August with my family for a couple of nights. We were pretty disappointed with the hotel in general. It reminded me of being in a UK council estate! It was noisy, we could get near the pool as it was completely crowded. The carpet in the lift was soaking wet from kids running in from the pool, and the carpet in the room felt sticky! The room was very musty smelling and just didn't feel clean. To be fair, the bathroom was OK. We almost paid extra for a rollaway bed for my son, but during our stay I caught sight of these beds, which were(for some unknown reason) being stored alongside the bins. The mattresses were stained and dirty and I would certainly not have let my son sleep on it! The location would have been fine if you had a car, but we had just flown in and were flying on elsewhere so did not have one. The shuttle bus would have been good but only if you tipped the driver very generously. Our driver was very nice on the way from the airport and told us his colleague would drop us off downtown the next day so we could explore. However, when we tried to arrange this, the colleague was really rude and said said he was busy and made us feel ridiculous for mentioning it. He eventually got us a taxi, but it is funny, it seemed to be driven by a friend of his and the fare was way more than we paid when we got our own taxi on the way back. We ate breakfast at a restaurant down the road because the Pam-Pam looked dreadful. Didn't like the area, didn't like the hotel,didn't feel safe, and my rating I have given the hotel of "Poor" is me being generous!

Reviews.Title: “ew”
Reviews.Author: Rod B
Reviews.Content: we thought we saw good reviews of this place, and it's certainly close to Sea World. The room was dirty, the carpet turns your feet black, and it's kind of trashy overall. The pool seemed cool initially, but we thought that some of the people staying at the hotel and hanging out by the pool were a bit thug-like and didn't stay at the pool long. For my wife, 2 kids and I we were okay for a couple nights, but won't stay here again, I prefer better-maintained (bathroom cleanliness, upkeep, fixtures, room cleanliness, noisy AC unit with loose cover that rattles, safe that was locked and unusable). the check in was okay, though the clerk was distracted and less than pleasant. our check out was better, and the fellow showed concern that we hadn't reported the unusable safe-but for me to hassle with reporting it, waiting for someone to fix it when we were in, tired, etc., was too much. he did seem to care though.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: raskolnikova
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its promise of a complimentary shuttle to San Diego attractions and to/from the airport as well as for the kitchenette. A shuttle did indeed come to pick us up eventually however I had to call them...they do not drop by automatically, say on the hour or half hour. Secondly they only willingly go to destinations of their choosing ie. SeaWorld, the Zoo, Lego Land and a couple of other places I wasn't interested in. We had hoped to get a ride to Balboa Park but reception made it seem like this would be a terribly arduous task for the driver even though he was free at the time. The room itself was much smaller than anticipated with a closet-like bathroom (sink outside right next to the microwave!?). I for one do not enjoy having to leave the washroom with dirty hands in order to wash up outside. Also, the proximity of the washroom to the "kitchen" area seemed slightly unhygienic to me. Beware of the paper thin walls as well--if you have noisy neighbours it might make it difficult to sleep in peace. We also were unable to make use of the outdoor pool as it was quite chilly outside and it is in the shade. It is also quite small. I wasn't crazy about the fact that housekeeping didn't replenish things like sugar, stir stix, cream, etc. on a regular basis. Also, despite a written request to please provide decaf coffee instead of regular we kept getting the wrong kind. Tea was available on request only and didn't come in the room. This was bothersome. Internet access is listed as part of the property amenities but there is only one public computer and usage is limited to 15 minutes a go. Suffice it to say we barely got to use it at all. I recommend travelling with a laptop if you have one as there is free Wifi (apparently). On the plus side, the hotel is ideally located if you are open to taking public transit, with a bus stop right outside taking you to Fashion Valley mall or, in the other direction, downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Cutting Too Many Corners”
Reviews.Author: jamzontheroad
Reviews.Content: This little hotel gets good reviews. This was my 4th time there and I was disappointed. First, they booked me in a handicap room and then explained that I had booked this. So, after room change and 2 queens instead of 1 king, I noticed that the sheets on one of the beds was stained--thank goodness it just looked to be coffee! The shower blasted so strongly that I had to keep my you-knows out of the way! The t.v. was adequate but it wouldn't cost a fortune to change to flat sceens in the rooms. And, for all hotels, it's about time to throw out the in-room coffee crap. I'll go up the road to Peet's, thank you very much! Finally, I thought the towels were quite coarse (old). Is it too much to ask for a soft towel? I will think twice before booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Economy hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: theglover
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy. Solid C. Rooms are clean. But they overlook a road. Design makes the potential for noise high.

Reviews.Title: “Kindest Hotel Staff Ever!”
Reviews.Author: NaomeF
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was amazing! They were always on top of it ready to help in any way they could. We had travel issues they helped; we had to leave a day early they helped. Had great recommendations of where to eat places to go and things to do! Would recommend it to anyone. It is not a brand new hotel but it is very clean and well kept. The food wasn’t great but not bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service and staff”
Reviews.Author: Michelle G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 8 days before moving to Vegas....what can I say?? The staff were awesome and the shuttle guys were so accomodating! We didn't have a car but we didn't have too much difficulty in getting around between the shuttle and taxis. The front office staff were more than happy to accommodate our requests and the concierge guys were quick to recommend tours that maximised our stay in this great city. If staying here check out Fashion Valley mall - we did some serious shopping there!!!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and surrounded by attractions”
Reviews.Author: missxanthropy
Reviews.Content: The Day's Hotel is an average hotel at an affordable rate Staff was friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. The hotel is close to attractions, multitude of beaches and 5 blocks from an outdoor shopping mall. A car rental is highly suggested as the highway is infront of the hotel. Easy enough to jump on and off and saves in expensive cab rides when you want to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain price in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Gummycandy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is packed in with a bunch of others right on the 8 freeway. It can be loud, especially if you are near the front of the property, closest to the road. The room itself was fine - clean, comfortable and good for a quick stay. Nice access to several shopping centers and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A nice budget hotel - ideal if visiting Sea World!”
Reviews.Author: christiana_eva
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as a stopover for our road trip from Los Angeles to Tijuana, Mexico. It was definitely a good choise for that since it was literally on the freeway. We needed a minimum of 10 minutes driving to get to the center of San Diego though. It is rather a fancy motel with hotel prices with the rooms set in blocks with their parking and a swimming pool. We had a room for 3 people and it was perfectly clean and comfortable with a mini kitchen and amenities. There is free wireless internet offered in the rooms and upon arrival they provided us with coupons for free continental breakfast of your choice. In order to get to your room you need to use a rigging ladder and there's one lift for every block which can be quite far, like in our case. But you shouldn't worry about accessing your room because they give out a map at the check in along with the breakfast and parking coupons. The only issue we had was with the air conditioning system since we really couldn't get around it. In case you are worried about the sleep quality, you shouldn't because eventhough it is on the freeway, there's absolutely no sort of noise in the rooms. We would recommend this hotel for those planning to visit the Sea World and unless we had a car and San Diego was part of a road trip, we wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Shuttle Service”
Reviews.Author: GoTed
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights for a fun vacation getaway. The girl at the front desk was abrupt and not very accomodating. She would not check us in until 4pm and stated as we had booked through a third party, she could not guarantee that as three adult women we could have two beds. When we returned to check in we indeed did have two beds but we were not certain this would occur. The room itself was just ok. I found hairs in the tub which always grosses me out. The bed was comfortable. Breakfast at the Pam Pam was fair, nothing special. What really makes this hotel shine are the shuttle drivers who were extremely knowledgeable and accomodating. With a quick phone call they were able to rescue us from Old Town and downtown when we had missed connections. They were always willing to adapt to take us to various locations throughout the city. In 4 days we only had to cough up for cab fares once. As well the Trolley stops right outside of the hotel for a tour of the city at a reasonable price. I would recommend this hotel for budget minded travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AxxaAxxa
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights for marine corp boot camp graduation. Everything I needed was there, clean and I slept well. Only a onerous power outage caused any problems and that I slept through easilly. Restaurant downstairs was good but rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean , convienent, and curtious”
Reviews.Author: Alwayshappy13
Reviews.Content: All of the hotel staff were very helpful and truly treated me as their guest. From the drivers of the shuttle, the severs in the restaurant, to the front desk staff. The room was good but we weren't in it unless we were taking a shower or to sleep. I mean really, it was 72 degrees and beautiful blue skies outside. The pool was great. We did use the MTS transit system to go to Old town, Mission Beach, and Pacific Beach. Very easy and the bus drivers helped us to seamlessly choose a route for our destination. Very friendly city. The bus stop was right outside the hotel too.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: dazyls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. We were promised a continental breakfast, but the hotel does NOT have a continental breakfast. So they gave us coupons at their restaurant for our continental breakfast which consisted of bagel or muffin, yogurt, orange, juice or coffee. The room was basic, I didn't feel like it was the safest area. A couple of times there were guys digging through the trash. They have a nice pool and jacuzzi, but watch out for the bees! The maids did a great job. Laundry room was great. We were in the back, so not next to the freeway, but there was still noises from car alarms, and people walking back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel for Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: baseballjz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our daughter's graduation from SDSU. We needed to save money on hotel since airline tickets were pretty pricey for our trip. It was nice, very reasonably priced and clean. Location was good. Management was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend staying there if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Worse hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: 123serena123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing like it shows in the pictures on web. Only good thing is the place it is located. But everything else is just terrible. First of all you cant turn the air conditioner on because it smells and there is fungus in the room. Also the in the bathroom the toilet is broken and shower is plain awful. Everything is old and dirty and it is the worst hotel I have ever stayed

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Granandgramplike2go
Reviews.Content: Stopped for 1 night which turned into extra night due to unexpected vehicle problem but chose to stay here rather than seek another place. Very friendly desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: JackieAckerman
Reviews.Content: After reading so many mixed reviews about this hotel I decided to go for it simply because the price was unbelievably cheap!! When my kids and I arrived we were quickly greeted by a very friendly woman who's name I can't remember. She quickly checked us in, giving us the option of ground floor or 2nd. She did suggest that the upper room would probably be a little bit more quiet, so we went with the 2nd floor. She gave me my receipt and on the back was directions to anywhere we would want to go in San Diego as far as tourist destinations are concerned. It definitely comes in handy when you don't wanna mess with the GPS all the time!! If the counter hadn't been right between us, I would've hugged her!!! lol. (The directions were very easy to follow to Old Town, SeaWorld, and Ralph's Supermarket.) When we got into our room, the A/C was already on for us, bed were neatly made (and very comfortable), floors were clean. I reserved a kitchenette so upon looking in the cabinets I found pots/pans - plates/bowls/saucers and Silverware, including a can opener and large utensils for stove top cooking. They also had a couple of dish towels and dish soap to do the dishes. The fridge was pretty large...big enough to fit everything we brought in our over-sized cooler. The only issue I had with the "kitchen area" was that the rear burner didn't work at all, the front one was fine though. We're not picky people so we didn't even bother to complain about it as its really not that big of a deal. The maid service was very nice. The days we decided not to use it, the maid called us just to confirm we didn't need anything... Not once has that ever happened to me at any hotel I've stayed at. I thought it was very nice and courteous. The pool!! The pool was awesome, along with the hot tub. Their pool is located in the very back of the hotel and is pretty secluded. Every night we were down there it was busy. Lots of families. It was nice getting to know the other guests, it just gave the place even more a warm homey feeling. The property is non-smoking! LOVE-LOVE-LOVE THAT!!! *Note* They do have an elevator for those who might find stairs difficult/impossible.

Reviews.Title: “They have rules, but are not willing to enforce them. They have policies, but don't abide by them.”
Reviews.Author: globe-traveler62
Reviews.Content: I have traveled extensively the last 25 years, throughout the U.S., for business and pleasure. I usually stay at similarly priced establishments. This is my third trip to San Diego, and the one and only time at this Days Inn. My daughter-in-law made the reservations because she heard it was an ok place to stay. I can tell you that in all my traveling, averaging 23 trips each year, this is the second worst establishment (a motel in Alvin, Texas, being the worst), that I have ever had the displeasure of staying at. We were told that check-in was 4:00 p.m., but when we arrived at 3:40 p.m., we were greeted by a line of 12 people, some of which were already checking in. My daughter-in-law asked for first floor rooms,but upon checking in, they said all the lower rooms were taken. The persons who clean the rooms are not consistent with their duties. We stayed three days and nights, and only on the day we checked in, did we have sufficient towels and washcloths (one set per guest). One night we chose to go to the pool for some relaxing time with my son, who had graduated earlier in the day, from U.S.M.C. Recruit Depot San Diego. When we got to the pool, at 9:15p.m., we counted 22 children, and 4 adults in the area. On a sign mounted by the hottub, it stated that persons under the age of 14 were not permitted in the hottub. When I contacted the front desk, they did not know there was a sign, let alone an age limit. They stated that it is a family oriented motel, and were not willing to enforce their own rules. Definitely not a place I would recommend to any friends, or people who would like to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Black Hawks Jr. Pee Wee team Loved the Days Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michele R
Reviews.Content: Our entire team went to San Diego for a football tournament. The General Manager and our Sales Director Courtney did everything to make the entire team feel welcome. They put the team rooms together, we were allowed to use a great area by the pool for team get togethers, the hotel had a pool movie and ice cream party that our team was able to enjoy. The entire stay was great for all 20+ rooms. It was so good that next year, some of the other age groups of players are going to compete and they have asked our team if they could join us at the hotel. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: kel1812
Reviews.Content: We got stuck here with many thanks to our travel agent, makes me wonder if they ever go to the hotels they send people. Our room was on the second floor, was dark and had an overwhelming stink of cleaner, even in the beds which made me wonder if the beds had been changed or just sprayed with something (sheets looked crumpled which made me wonder even more) and just did not appear clean. Whenever anyone walked past our room on the walkway our beds bounced, I did try to find another hotel but everything was totally sold out so couldnt shift. Walkways were dirty, with water also running across them from the ac units, truly would not have surprised me to see strippers etc hanging out around the hotel as it really was quite scummy, cant comment on the price as it was part of a package done by a travel agent but in my opinion any amount would be too much.

Reviews.Title: “Will Never Book Again- Uncompromising Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: astar7674
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here in Aug, unlike the reviews we'd read before booking (thru Seaworld Vacation), and much too our dismay, the hotel staff here are stubborn and uncompromising. We originally booked double queens for a family of 4, and when we checked in, they gave us single King bed and some offer(?) roll-in-bed or sofa-convertable because 'they are fully booked'. And no matter how we pleaded with them, they would not budge from their statement that 'booking with 3rd party' gives you standard-run-of-the-mill bed(s), despite me showing my original Seaworld vacation confirmation, and the fact that Seaworld would not even let me book a King room due to our party of 4! To rub in salt to wound, the staff even mentioned rooms are not guaranteed as we booked through 3rd party??? well, I am not going to mentioned staff names, but the funny thing is that after complaining to Seaworld Vacation, we were told Day's Hotel is one of their premier hotels (so this puts 'booking through 3rd party to rest!!) and after talking with hotel management, they agree that our experience should not had happened andt the staff should have been more accomodating. In any case, after this really rotten experience, we will never book or refer this hotel to any of our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Bling1975
Reviews.Content: We normally only stay at higher rated hotels but due to Comic-Con everything was sold out or extremely expensive. Even this hotel charged a bit more than I normally would be prepared to pay for this kind of hotel but the area was good for us and we liked the free parking. We opted for the business section at the back of the hotel area next to the swimming pool. The room was a good size and clean with a big king size bed, a table and two armchairs as well as a desk area. As it was at the back we were never bothered by noise other than from the A/C unit (sometimes the A/C smelled a bit of beer when we started it in the afternoon - not so nice). The pool area looked nice but we never used it. We never found out how to get the free breakfast but we bought breakfast at the restaurant the first day and never again. The bagels tasted stale. But we had a fridge and microwave in the room. The best thing about the hotel is the comfy bed, the cleaning and the location. The best mall (Fashion Valley) is just a 2 min drive away and so is another mall with bigger shops like Target and Best Buy. It is also very convenient for Sea World and the Zoo and it is located between Downtown and La Jolla. We spent a lot of time in La Jolla and Del Mar and it was very easy to drive there.

Reviews.Title: “Never again- Tried to be thrifty on Bus Budget- Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I travel to SD often and this time was only in for 1 night and thought Hotel Circle is convenient to where I need to be. It is - but never again! This is a trap for large families seeing the zoo and sea world! Room was out dated, not clean the couch in the room was not one I would have let my dog sit on. The crowd this place attracts does not lend it self to a relaxing evening after a long day on the road from work. On a budget? with family? dont care about your car or who parks next to it? Stay here. Otherwise- look elsewhere! One positive note: the front desk staff are very courteous and pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “Not as enjoyable as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: ahoyhoy
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here three times in the past and this last visit will be our last. We had asked for a quiet room and were put on the ground floor. It was very noisy due to the foot traffic and road noise. The most annoying part were the pizza flyers that were stuck in our door at late hours of the night and early morning waking us from our sleep. This is not the hotel's doing but they could have monitored this a little better. The room itself was clean and fine if you just need a place to sleep and the location is central but we will be staying elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: bdwill
Reviews.Content: Very very clean, friendly, quiet. Will stay again next time. Beautiful, well kept rooms and landscaping. Delicious breakfast. Helpful staff. Overall, best Hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: dessertfoxone
Reviews.Content: We really appreciate the 'no pet' policy and no smoking policy of this hotel. This puts this hotel on the top of our list for places to stay in San Diego. The room was quiet, clean, well equipped, in excellent condition and also the swimming pool was clean, well maintained and towels were provided. The staff was helpful and friendly. A few minor complaints - the free breakfast provided as part of a promotional to some of the guests was not available to us because we didn't book during the right month. When we saw the free breakfast, it was a basic continental breakfast. Also, the pool deck is very slippery and needs to have a rougher surface.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chb1081
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on February/2011 for 3 days. Room was clean and also the bathroom, room with good size with 2 beds. Complimentary breakfast was a negative point, they serve at the local restaurant, and you have no option to choose, they bring you the breakfast and you deliver them the ticket you have. Complimentary parking for our car, very positive. Wireless connection in the room, microwave and refrigerator inside the room which I loved sooo useful. They have free shuttle service available to SeaWorld, my friends and I, we liked the service. I'd recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Great restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: dmritter
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice during my visit to San Diego. The location is great and very close to Old Town. The restaurant is great!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LPL35
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price. The exterior is a little "dated", but the rooms have been upgraded and are very nice and clean. Also, very quiet. We didn't notice any unusual odors. The pool area is well kept and surrounded by trees and plants. The desk clerks were attentive and helpful. I would suggest utilizing their free shuttle service as much as possible, because parking is very tight and when you get back, it's hard to find a space close. If you do use the shuttle, make reservations for it early, as they fill up fast. The only down side to our stay, was that they discontinued serving the continental breakfast the week before we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Grat value, great service good location”
Reviews.Author: Reatie123
Reviews.Content: Great budget hotel,free wi-fi, free breakfast . Rooms were kept clean, fresh towels and the shuttle drivers especially mike were so obliging. Area surrounding did not offer many options for food or entertainment, although fashion valley mall is only a10min walk.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Smitty100299
Reviews.Content: Days hotel is your average hotel. Rooms are clean, shower was good (Enough hot water and pressure). It is close to everything and we got it at a very decent price. Can not complain the kids had a blast!! Parking was tight (like most parkings in San Diego). We had breakfast at PAM PAM on site and it was pretty good!

Reviews.Title: “If you have basic standards, DON'T STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Brooklynborn76
Reviews.Content: The minute we pulled up, we noticed how much so the facility was in disrepair. The building needed a paint job, there were cracks, etc. However, I attempted to keep an open mind, so we went to the front to check in. Aside from the outdated decor, which again, I was willing to overlook, the staff seemed pleasant (although he was coughing all over everything!!). We went to our room and walking along the terrace was an overwhelming smell of urine. It was disgusting. Someone literally urinated on the walkway. The cleaning staff happened to be working on the room just in front of where the smell was coming from, but didn't seem to be phased. When we opened the door to our room, there was a very musty odor that was ineffectively being covered up by lemon furniture cleaner. The room was dark, stinky & in need of a makeover. We left immediately, but not before making our reasons known to the front desk. This is a gross motel & I would never stay here, especially with my toddler. Run the other way!!! YUCK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, will stay again soon.”
Reviews.Author: chrisandsummer
Reviews.Content: We just love this hotel, we have stayed here about 5 times in the last few years. Always a great price, very clean and friendly staff. Very close to Sea World, beaches, and downtown. I'm planning my next trip to San Diego for Labor day and will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and great location”
Reviews.Author: dontcallmecas
Reviews.Content: It is is hotel circle so it is centrally located. Bus/Trolly route is within walking distance. The bathroom door did not close all the way but I went with my significat other so it was not a big deal. Pool/hot tub is nice. Nothing fancy but I recommend it to anyone who is traveling to San Diego and is on a budget. It is in a great location and is fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was great”
Reviews.Author: suszeq
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, the beds were very comfortable, nice pillows and towels. Hotel staff very kind and helpful. The pool and spa were great and the free continental breakfast was a nice start to each day. We will definately make this our regular hotel when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: jenak02
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and our stay was wonderful! The room was clean and modern, the cleaning staff were great and the front desk staff were incredibly helpful. The continental breakfast started at 6:30 a.m. which was nice for those of us who wake-up early AND checkout wasn't until noon, which made for a relaxing exit at the end of our stay. Thank you for the stay.....we'll definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4kidsandcrazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night, and for the price we got, it was a great hotel. Very basic room with slight funny odor, but clean. The bed was amazingly comfortable and I slept like a baby. The breakfast was a typical hotel breakfast. If I was on a budget, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a good night's rest”
Reviews.Author: kmaz100
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while we visited SeaWorld. The rooms were clean and comfortable,and included a coffeemaker and microwave oven. A shuttle bus to SeaWorld was an added bonus. there is WiFi available in the rooms on the computer and printer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Alex”
Reviews.Author: ArielH0
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a great value, parking is free as well as the internet .The staff was kind and helpful, especially Alex. I would definitely will be back when I'll be around.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: woobiesmomx4
Reviews.Content: It was very reasonable price and clean. The room was a little small but adequate. Close to the freeway and the sites we visited. Pool was great and clean. Parking was tight and if you came back late you had to search for a spot. Pam Pam was good for food. It was a very light breakfast. Mini muffins, bagels coffee or juice. I was disappointed there was not even cold cereal or toast. The restaurant did offer full breakfast if you wanted to pay.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: vansmomma
Reviews.Content: I was on the fence about booking this hotel, but I am SO glad that I did. The price was what finally made my decision, but I had concerns up until we arrived. I had read that the free shuttle they offered was a nightmare, so I was very skeptical that it wasn't going to work out. We were picked up within 30 minutes of our arrival to the airport. The shuttle service was fine the entire time and we had NO problems. The shuttle came in handy for our seaworld and zoo outings. Also, the shuttle driver made himself available in the evenings for guests, which we used a few times as well. The room itself is clean, with newer/remolded bathrooms. This hotel offers a fridge/microwave in every room. Most hotels we were looking at did not even offer this amenity. The pool was clean and nice. They even offered a continental breakfast for free. While it is not much (juice and bagels), it did come in handy some mornings not to have to eat out. The area is nice and safe. I felt very secure there. The hotel is not close to anything to be able to walk to, but it is in a good area. Oh, and the added plus for me, was that the hotel right next store had a starbucks inside. I have to have my latte's in the morning, so this was a nice perk!! I would definitely stay here again. I think it is great for families and all of the above!! For the price, you really can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Hotel with 5 Star Hospitality/Service”
Reviews.Author: korpur8
Reviews.Content: Wow! We were so impressed with the service we recieved as soon as we walked into the hotel. We both travel,however,my boyfriend is a seasoned traveler and travels extensively, nationaly/internationally. On a last minute whim,we decided to stay in San Diego and picked this hotel since it was inexpensive and close to the venue we were going to. We booked our room through Expedia on the phone,which turned into a nightmare...we arrived to the hotel and learned that the room we booked had been booked for the NEXT night! Well,after only getting more frustrated as we tried to rectify Expedia's mistake,we decided, that it was easier to just stay an extra night. Thankfully there was room.The gal at the front desk was so sweet and could see our frustration,she offered us the room at a very low discount rate for that night!! WOW,as if the rooms weren't already incredibly reasonable. From that point on we recieved 5star service...including phone calls to our room making sure we were pleased and comfortable.... YES and YES!! Our room was perfect for what we were paying..breakfast poolside was lovely..but most of all it was BLANCA,RALY and ALEX (and I know of 2 others whom names I did not catch,but I'll bet you know who you are:-) who made our last minute stay perfect!! So much so,that we have chosen to go back next week for 2 nights instead of heading to Santa Monica!! Hospitality/Customer Service seems to be a lost art these days...we will be recommending your hotel to all our friends and business associates...THANK YOU and See you next week!!

Reviews.Title: “very cozy and convenient”
Reviews.Author: YYHH7788
Reviews.Content: the location is good, right besides highway. there r suttle bus sending ppl to the Seaworld. The room is clean, quiet. Bed is comfortable. we have a nice relaxing night after whole day out. I like they have a computer and printer at the lobby. So whatever we want, just be there to check email and print out maps (we are foreigners, using data is expensive). Price is good too!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and incredibly good value."”
Reviews.Author: quickerwit
Reviews.Content: Great value: Free breakfast, free WiFi, free shuttle and even free parking. Many hotels in San Diego charge for parking. The staff were really helpful when our teenage son managed to lock himself out of our room. We also enjoyed the bagel breakfast by the pool, which is at the far end of the hotel from the Interstate and so pretty quiet. Clean room and well laid out. We stayed two nights and we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: brandtsresort
Reviews.Content: They had a great location! Close to the trolley lines that would take you everywhere. They picked you up at the airport, zoo, sea world, all the major attractions. The staff was excellent and very informed as to what was going on in town and everywhere else. They even had a very nice little restaurant on site. Along with a laundromat. What a place they have here with excellent landscaping. They have it all!!!! Keep up the good work. Linda

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: sol1028
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Days Hotel for 5 days with my husband and 7yr son. It was great. The room had a a safe, mini fridge and microwave. They have free breakfast by the pool in the morning, bagels,coffee, juice and fruit. Beds are comfy, staff is very nice and friendly. Pool is good size and they have a hot tub. On my next visit to San Diego I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Valuea and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tltfaas
Reviews.Content: I received a free upgrade to a king suite and I really appreciated the comfort and quietness of the room. The television was nice, the bed was really, really comfortable and there were six pillows. The shower had a special head on it and the water pressure was fantastic. It was one of the best hotel showers I've ever seen. The pool looked nice and there is a free breakfast poolside in the morning. I will definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Booked this for free shuttle but disappointed”
Reviews.Author: geelongfamily
Reviews.Content: So we booked this place because of the complimentary shuttle to sea world and the zoo but on arrival at lunch time was told the shuttles only went twice a day at set times and so we luckily had a car and drove to the parks Being froma foreign country we were looking forward to not driving. Rooms were clean and beds comfortable but don't get much else for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise and snooze is a great deal at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: vsclausen
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the cruise and snooze package and added two extra nights. We had absolutely no problems with checkin nor the shuttle to and from the cruise terminal, nor anything else for that matter. The hotel is central to everything we visited the safari park, went whale watching on the America, and enjoyed the atmosphere at Pacific Beach and the Gas Lamp Quarter all before our cruise. The folks at the Days Hotel were very accomodating with an e mail before the stay offering help with the local area. they were busy at tiomes, (I guess our timeing was really good) and always had smiles. The room and covered parking during our hotel stay was great. The parking for the week at sea was in an area that could be easily overseen by the hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Picky123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times and will go back any time I'm in San Diego! Rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. Great value especially for the price. Staff has always gone above and beyond to assist whether I needed shuttle service, directions around town and even printing my boarding passes for me. Free shuttle to MCRD and Airport is a bonus and the pool area is always nice and clean. If I had to point out one negative it would be the parking lot. Plenty of spaces but narrow drive thru area.

Reviews.Title: “No Service”
Reviews.Author: Ericstuff
Reviews.Content: There shuttle was not only bad timing for a cruise but we were told it was full the night before. When they called a shuttle service for us we found out that they charge the drivers $5 for the call, this was passed on to us as well as being charged more than the usaly fee. The staff is rude and shady. Checkin time was 4:00 pm, for someone picking up travelers from the air port this seems late. We ended up having to pay another shuttle service for three trips that cost us $120. None of our party members will be using Days anything in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, beware of motion sensor lights”
Reviews.Author: svgp
Reviews.Content: We asked for a room away from the street, ended up not getting one. (Probably because they have a specific layout for rooms with kitchenette) . We couldn't get a wink of sleep the first night, because the lights would turn on automatically every 15-20 minutes. We called up the front desk, were told that these were motion sensor lights with no master switch to turn it off. We ended up removing the bulbs. The next day, we asked for a change of room, the staff upgraded us to a business suite, free of cost, also moved all our luggage to the new room. I was pretty impressed when they took care of moving our stuff in the fridge (which I had forgotten all about) to the fridge in the new room. 5 stars for customer service, 2 stars for room maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “It is easy to recommend this very clean, wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RosemaryandBill
Reviews.Content: Everything at this hotel is very clean. They even wash the sidewalk outside your door each day. We had a bouquet of flowers on the sink and the maid put fresh water in it. Our plans changed because of snow at home and Alex, the manager could not have been more helpful and accommodating. The heated pool and hot tub were great. The parking is free. Few hotels in San Diego offer free parking. It is close to the major sites and highways. We will stay here again. This hotel is a real find.

Reviews.Title: “days hotel is a excellent place to go”
Reviews.Author: elmo49
Reviews.Content: me and my family went to days hotel circle. the service there was excellent and the rooms were very clean.the location was near all the attractions.their shuttle took us to sea world with no problems, all the employees there were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodations were fine; service was TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Dadwith2inTow
Reviews.Content: After waiting in line 20 minutes to check in, we were given a key that didn't open the door. No biggie unless your room is all the way at the opposite end of the property. Then, as we checked in, we inquired about the complimentary hotel shuttle that would take us to the cruise ship. We asked about the best time to take it...10AM or 12 Noon. Clerk said 12 Noon. Little did we know that we had to SIGN UP for the shuttle. I guess asking him about it wouldn't have tipped him enough to figure that we might WANT TO GO ON IT!!!!! Needless to say, when we came down at 11:45 to catch the shuttle, it was full and we had to wait an extra hour and a half for it to load up and take the guests then come back for us. No biggie, unless you're waiting there with a 3 and 4 year old and you now have no where to go. BTW, don't forget to ASK for a receipt if you pay cash. As the same genius who caused all of these other problems forgot to mention that we paid in cash, so when we checked out, the clerk had no record of it. Would I stay there again? Well, if they offer me a complimentary night for my inconvenience, I think I'd rather pay the money to get the piece of mind knowing that I won't have to go through THAT AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad, not too great.”
Reviews.Author: SquareBadge
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for our quick getaway after careful consideration to price and extensive research of reviews on the 250 plus San Diego area hotels. The Good: The hotel was easy to find. Located on a strip with tons of other hotels right off the highway. The staff was very courteous and friendly. The room was clean and comfortable. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and conducive to sleep. Microwave and small refrigerator. The Bad: The hotel is right on the highway. We were issues a room on the second floor, closest to the road, which meant closest to the highway. On the first night I thought a Police car was going to come through the door into the room . The highway noise is very loud. I mean, very. I suppose if you were in the back of the complex, or even on the side away from the oncoming traffic it wouldn’t be so bad, maybe not even noticeable. In defense of the hotel, our room and the room above it were probably the worst for noise so it may not be fair to judge the whole hotel this way. Speaking of noise, I don’t know what this hotel was constructed from. I bet it wasn’t originally a hotel. I say this because of the squeaky floors. I could hear every step the family above us made as they traversed the hotel room continuously. Walking with their heavy steps, pounding across the floor, boom, boom, boom, squeeeeek, thud. It was like a bad apartment building. We’ve stayed in a lot of hotels, and I never remember hearing anyone above. So, ask for a room on the top floor if this kind of thing bothers you. Thank goodness I sleep like the dead. Parking. We arrived late on the first night and found the last parking space in the hotel complex. I know it was the last space for sure because we drove through the whole complex. While we were always able to find a space, it was tight and not always near our room. On another note, I think there is a conspiracy in southern California to weed out large cars through the application of small parking spaces. We were given a luxury car at the car rental as they were out of what we purchased. So we got a big car. Good luck in those tiny parking spaces. You may fit into the space but have to exit your vehicle through the trunk and hope you don’t run into whoever you parked next to. No breakfast. Some of the reviews mentioned a continental breakfast and I could have sworn I read something on a website about a breakfast, but when I inquired about its location with the front desk, an eyebrow went up along with that “what are you talking about look?” So, no breakfast, but there was coffee in the lobby as well as a coffee maker in the room. We looked at the pool and Jacuzzi, they looked nice but we did not experience them. Would I stay here again? Maybe, as long as I was on the top floor and away from the highway. Happy tavels!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, greater location,employees very helpful,enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: snowbirdcbk
Reviews.Content: This motel had been booked through a travel tour agency, and we were extremely happy with our ten day stay. Rudy,the conceriege, shuttle bus operator, tour operator, and etc was very helpful and went out of his way to make our stay the best. Motel located near all major attractions and bus services. Great place to stay. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Handy to zoo, clean, great pool!"”
Reviews.Author: Kaz_USA_2010
Reviews.Content: Nice big room, awesome pool, good cafe/restaurant. Very nice stay, in spite of Brian, who checked us in, having the personality of a door knob. Room was a bit noisy because of proximity to the road, but would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and affordable.”
Reviews.Author: 602Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife for two nights. Staff were great, room was clean. We were very happy with the hotel. I am not one for fancy chains. I got what I wanted. Location! I am staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Family emergency”
Reviews.Author: charkeydog
Reviews.Content: My brother-in-law went to San Diego on 1/4/11 for a business conference & became ill on the evening he arrived, was taken to UCSD Hillcrest, the nearest hospital,t by ambulance and has been there since then. Four weeks now. My sister flew out from their home in Rochester, NY on 1/8 and is still there, I flew out on 1/20 for 10 days & have returned, to Ft. Lauderdale. My sister moved from her first hotal which was near Days Hotel because of security reasons. We spent every day at the hospital, from early morning until early evening. The hotel staff is wonderful, helpful, compassionate. The drivers of the shuttle always accommodated our needs. Housekeeping was outstanding, the laundry room was extremely clean. This is a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Days Inn I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Kdsd731
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a great price. The room was clean and updated, very comfortable bed. I was staying out in San Diego for a conference and needed to print something, I was pleasantly suprised to find they had a computer available with free printing. The staff is also friendly. I would definetly stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price -- convenient location”
Reviews.Author: brendonla
Reviews.Content: Needed 2 standard rooms w/king-sized beds for one night -- didn't need to be anything fancy, just someplace clean and safe to rest our heads after a day at the San Diego Zoo for a birthday party. Booked here due to the above-average reviews on Trip Advisor and the rate with the AAA discount was probably the best I could find booking just six days away from arrival date. Also, this property doesn't show up on any of the bedbug report websites, which was another big reason for booking. Booked directly through the hotel toll-free line to ensure we got the AAA rate (though the ihotelier.com booking engine showed a slightly cheaper rate, I opted to stay with the res I called to make; I'm a big believer in booking directly w/ a property vs. relying on a third-party system or agency website). We arrived slightly after 6 pm to check in; front desk clerk was polite and efficient. Stayed in 2 rooms on third level of the next-to-last building (note: the last building "the Sunset Wing" has enclosed hallways, which is probably why the management can call this a "hotel" when the majority of the rooms are clearly motel-style and open up to the outside). There are elevators in each building, but they are not large -- if you need to ride up in a wheelchair you might want to call to verify you'll be able to fit in the lift. A computer in the lobby for internet access is available for checking in for flights or looking up local restaurants or attraction info. Bedding linens and bath towels were all clean; carpet looks recently installed -- no stains or bad odors. Standard room has mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron and ironing board. Doors had working locks and felt safe (yes, there was a _tiny_ gap at the bottom of door, but I'd attribute this to the building settling over the years - and the door frames followed suit). The couch in the room was the only sore spot for us: there were clearly white stains on it and it was very old and faded -- management should swap these out or just get rid of them altogether. Disgusting -- we laid towels down on this just in case. We ordered a grilled cheese sandwich for our son and a bottle of wine from Pam Pam to accompany the pizza we ordered from one of the chain pizzerias -- they delivered without issue right to our door. Parking is still free. Bed was very comfy and at night the room was quiet aside from room AC we turned on or bathroom flushing. Rude neighbors insisted on allowing their door next to ours slam shut in the morning despite the fact that we had our doorknob "quiet please" sign out, but that's not the property management's issue. We didn't try the pool - no time for that. Didn't bring laptop computer, so can't speak to how good the wifi coverage is, but used my AT&T Blackberry for looking up info -- good strong signal coverage for AT&T wireless users. For breakfast recommend Ricky's Restaurant on Hotel Cir. South nearby -- very good! Overall, drove away the next morning thinking we got great value for the price we paid. I'd come back and recommend to travelers on a budget, but there's another major property in Hotel Circle area I want to try also that is suppose to have had major makeover on their rooms recently. My one last comment to management: consider moving the cigarette butt receptacles AWAY from the elevators: non-smokers do NOT want to smell cigarette smoke as they exit the elevator; consider putting these at the end of each building (maybe one day San Diego will follow Santa Monica and Culver City's examples and ban cigarette smoking in public places altogether).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for good value”
Reviews.Author: juliechen
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel for 2 nights before our Mexico crusie vacation. Hotel room is big and clean. Free Shuttle bus runs from airport, San Diego Sea World and zoo. Therefore, no need to rent a car in town. Hotel is also very close to shopping mall and convention centre. Free wireless internet. The restaurant (Pam Pam) next to the hotel is a little bit expensive. Overall, great value compare to other big name hotels.

Reviews.Title: “on foot in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: yorpardner
Reviews.Content: The hotel: Among many scattered along a limited access highway. 3 nights on the 3rd floor while on business at USD. Friendly, helpful staff. Room kinda stinky at first (imagine a laundry basket of old damp sox after a month). Not sure what was up with that, but housekeeping spritzed it and I aired it out- tolerable after that. Room had a mini fridge and microwave. They advertise high speed internet but it was so slow I couldn't use it even for email, much less work. The shuttle service was very helpful, including free pick-up from the airport. Food: there's an attached restaurant to almost all of these hotels, this one included. I didn't eat there- it seems to be mostly in the soups and sandwiches category. There are almost no services of any sort nearby, apart from a liquor/ minimart about a block away. The hotel sits on the corner of Hotel Circle South and Bachman Drive. I hiked up Bachman Drive (15 minutes uphill) to University Ave. Lots of food and services there, including a Whole Foods (30 minutes total). I walked a mostly very nice hour to Little Italy (Puerto La Boca), again enjoying the walk back to the hotel. Also walked 1 1/4 hour to the Toronado pub- sketchier streets, and they didn't have the beer I was hoping for (Alesmith). Other walking: Conference let out early, decided to walk from USD to hotel (1 1/4 hr)- bad walking with traffic and no sidewalks, fording mudslide debris. Only good part was a stop at the Ballast Point brewery at the bottom of the USD hill for a restorative 4 oz of good porter.

Reviews.Title: “We would love to go back”
Reviews.Author: rawnyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 days in the beginning of our vacation and then another 2 days before going home. I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel. We used the shuttle to be picked up and dropped off at the airport without any problems, what a great convenience and money saver. Our room was exactly what we expected, nice big comfortable king size bed with lot's of pillows, great shower, clean, with lot's of towels. Shuttle driver and front desk were always helpful. Having Pam's Pam's available for room service was great since we ended up being caught in the rain storm that hit Southern CA. for a day and not having to go out in the pouring rain was a great bonus.
