Having a stop for the Old Town Trolley right outside the hotel was also very convenient, and the Trolley Tour was great and worth every penny. If you want a nice clean room that's in a great location and very affordable with great service this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel:)”
Reviews.Author: Cristina20102011
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews, but is really weird that people can give bad reviews to this one. It is a very clean hotel, the staff is very friendly and our room perfectly fitted the description and the pics seen on Internet. The pool has a good size, the water is warm and the jacuzzi is awesome:) The location is very good, too. You have a bus that's right across the street that takes you to the Old Town and to Downtown. You also have the trolley 5-6 min walking distance from the hotel. Happy New Year everyone and thanks for making our stay so pleasant! Cristina S. PS San Diego is a great city, by the way! Sorry that I didn't take any pics to prove I am right.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and very good service”
Reviews.Author: Raspathway
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night for an interview at Rady Children's hospital in San Diego. Hotel paid for a shuttle for myself and two others also going to the hospital that day. Price was great at $79 for one night for a fairly large and clean room. Although all rooms open to the parking lot there were no problems with noise and I got a sound nights sleep. Would be hard to stay here without a car though if you wanted to get anywhere in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trekkrsal
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, but very clean, and had a very helpful staff. It has a small refrigerator, microwave, and a coffee maker. The bed was extrememly comfortable. The front desk staff are helpful in giving directions, and offering suggestions. They also have a heated pool. I am returning to San Diego for business next March, with four others, and I am going to book this hotel for all of us. Can't beat the price for the location and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Lanzy27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights during July 2010. What we didnt know is that the hotel does a free shuttle service pick up from the train station which saved us quite a bit of money. Once arrived, our room was on the 2nd floor and was quite good. Beds were comfy and wasnt noisy at all. Pool is a little small and can be quite busy when there are small children around but good enough for a quick swim. The hotel also has free internet for 15 minutes in the lobby which was very useful. They also have a free shuttle to Seaworld and the San Diego Zoo. Make sure you book in advance for a spot on the bus as times to depart can be early or late. If you are wanting to see all of San Diego, my friend and I used the Old trolley service which is orange and green tram. It stops right outside Pam Pams cafe. It costs between 20-40 for a ticket and it takes you all around San Diego and you can hop on and hop off when ever you like and there will be another tram every 30 minutes. Although towards 4pm the shuttle becomes full and sometimes the tram will keep going so you may end up waiting for over an hour. Pam Pams was good basic food but Once is enough for dinner and breakfast and Hotel staff are very helpful and friendly. I would stay here again just because it has what you need at a basic rate.

Reviews.Title: “clean large room, easy location, free parking. Very satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: keekaboo
Reviews.Content: We thought it might be noisier and were pleasantly surprised how quiet it was. The room was larger than we have come to expect in CA. We were also able to park right outside our door, We had no trouble finding this hotel,nor did we have any difficulty getting on or off the highway.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyR073
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say probably one of the cleanest hotel rooms & best night's sleep in a hotel I've ever experinced! The customer service from the staff was outstanding no matter what time of day you came in contact with them, which was a pleasant surprise. We were amazed that the hotel is centrally located for all of the activities in the area so drive time was hardly anything. I'd stay again in a second & I thank the whole staff for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great comfy beds, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: buggrac
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in was suprised to find they were going to charge us 50.00 a room for incidentals and needed a credit card, did not bring one, stood outside for half an hour until could come to some agreement. Since we booked thru a travel agent was all paid for, still wouldnt let us to our rooms. Nice shuttle driver, terrible hours, especially to the MCRD graduation, not flexible at all. Try not to do laundry after 9pm, they mean it when they lock the doors at 10pm. Not helpful or friendly staff at all.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value, OK room, pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: Sometimestravler
Reviews.Content: For San Diego, the price was reasonable and the location is pretty good. The staff was efficient. The bed was comfortable. It is an older, motel-style facility. It has been remodeled, but could use some more remodeling help. The first room I was in had ants in the bathroom and a plumbing issue, so I moved to another room. The second room also had a plumbing issue. Ask for a room back from the freeway if you don't want freeway noise. Don't eat at the onsite restaurant; it was terrible in my opinion. I would recommend it if you need a place on a tight budget. If you have a little more money to spend, try something a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GoodGuest
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in a very practical part of San Diego. I rented a car from AVIS - short walk under the bridge and shopped at the Westfield shopping centre which is about a 5 minute drive. Parking is free at this hotel - many hotels in San Diego charge upwards of US$15 per day - I have no idea why they charge. I stayed in a room which was part of the back block - they charge more for these but I think it was worth it as enclosed room. Room was fine - everything cleaned and as promised. Internet worked well - no problems at all. Airport shuttle to airport was good - just make sure you book. Pam Pam restuarant was fine for what it is - a cafe style restuarant. I had fish for dinner which was good and breakfast twice - all good. You are served quickly. All in all, for the amount paid I could not fault this hotel or its restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a dump !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hotelzrockzz
Reviews.Content: First off when the toilet was flushed it would howl like a coyote , there was semen on the remote control , the lodgenet never worked , the air conditioner was loud , urine was caked on the base of the toilet. I have not a clue how they can charge 100 bucks a night and even stay in buisness for that matter. Oh and the headboard in the room next door was banging against the wall ! Pam Pam's restauraunt was terrible !!!!. Do yourself a favor and stay at Humphrey's half moon inn. That hotel is much better.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: GraceofGod
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be super friendly and helpful. We planned a family celebration for four days and used the meeting room facility. The special event coordinators (Courtney and Ingrid) were both great. Our event went smoothly even when we made a couple changes in the middle. We catered two meals for our event through the hotel and it was also great. The rooms and beds were comfortable, clean, and a good value. Our experience for all our family members was excellent. We highly recommend this hotel for the budget-minded family who wants more than bare-bones accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but very clean and in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Scratcher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and, while not as "fancy" as some others on Hotel Circle, we were very comfortable. The room was spacious enough, the bathroom sink area was big enough to not be crowded, and the room was very quiet. The only noise we noticed were doors closing as people were leaving in the morning, but no sound through the walls at all. Beds were firm and comfortable, although the pillows could be replaced. This room was exceptionally clean also. The location is great - right on "the 8" and close to the other intersection highways 805 and 15. The parking is free, which is a real perk. And there is a fridge, coffee maker, and microwave in the room, so we were able to fix our own breakfast each day.

Reviews.Title: “The email welcome and thank yous were a nice touch”
Reviews.Author: lulu547
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days and nights there in 2 rooms,myself and my spouse in one and my elderly parents in the other. We each had kitchenettes which was great. Air conditioner was quite loud, had to turn it off to try to get to sleep. It was on the bus route that connected with the trolley system and it was very easy going around the city and to Mission Beach and La Jolla from there. Front desk staff not overly friendly but they were very busy. We were to have breakfast vouchers with our package that I didn't remember and didn't get the 3 of them till check out, a little too late. I would stay there again for ease of access to day trips, shopping etc. The pool area is at the back and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service given by the drivers!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hili082
Reviews.Content: At first we weren't so sure if we should stay at this hotel, but since we wanted a cheap one and since it was just for 2 nights, we chose this hotel. I could say that the service given by the two drivers who were extremly friendly and also gave us a lot of information and tips regarding San Diego, was excellent. It made our holiday in San Diego one we will definitely remember. They came for us at the airport, took us to seaworld and were always there when we needed them!!! They even saved us from losing our van to go to los angeles! So for an excellent service there's no other hotel you should go to!

Reviews.Title: “awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: piratedad
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for 2 days in august 2010. The hotel was in a great location close to the beach and other attractions we had planned to visit. The staff at the front desk was courteous and helpful. We arrived to our room late the first night. The room was not as clean as we would have liked and seemed to be very run down. It was an uncomfortable night for the family. The next morning I went to the front desk and let them know of the problems, they were polite and immediately moved us to another room. The new room was very nice in fact it was better than some of the higher priced places we have stayed in the past. The room was clean quiet and very modern decorated, we all got a good nights rest. After returning home I spoke to Barbara from the main office. She has to be the most polite and caring customer service person I have ever dealt with , she went above and beyond what I would have expected in this type of experience! What started out as a nightmare turned into a pleasant, fun trip for the family. Thanks to the awesome attention to our issues from Barbara and the experience of the 2nd nites stay we would go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, appreciated hot tub and shuttle”
Reviews.Author: Anniemary58
Reviews.Content: We have no complaints about the room or service, we appreciated having a hot tub, the pool was too cold though. The driver who picked us up at the airport was friendly and not late. Unfortunately, we had a sick teen and needed to find a drugstore and no one seemed to be able to direct us. We were told there was a mall we could walk to, and someone said there was a drugstore behind it, so my sister and I walked down in the dark, only to discover the mall was so huge, we didn't know where "behind the mall" would be, there was no drugstore in the mall - it seemed to be full of stores like Maceys, Bloomingdales, etc. and no one seemed to be able to tell us where we could find one. We tried to then walk back to the hotel, got lost, finally found a cab, and he didn't know where to find a drugstore either. Fortunately the cafe' at the hotel had a few choices of flu/cold products. All that to say we found the location to be a bit remote and we could have used a bit more help in finding what we needed. By the way, we passed a steak house not too far into our walk to the mall, for anyone who would like to know that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Us!”
Reviews.Author: Malificent16
Reviews.Content: The Days Hotel was perfect for us! I read some of the negative reviews, but I wanted to go with an open mind. We stayed for 3 days. We rented a car, but we were unfamiliar with San Diego. So the shuttle offered by the Days Hotel was very appealing. In fact it was the only hotel to offer such a service in the area. Wow, the service was great! All of the drivers were extremely helpful. And all of them were on time, in spite of the crazy San Diego traffic! This service was a godsend for our family. Also, I was very pleasantly surprised at how immaculate the rooms were! Granted the hotel is older and the rooms are small, but the accommodations were very comfortable! The staff were also extremely helpful. On the day I arrived, I had to get to the Maritime Museum because I was scheduled for a cruise. Alex was extremely helplful in directly me to the trolley, which got me to the museum in 20 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, fairly good location”
Reviews.Author: Jsw4773
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine and although initially I thought it was a bit overpriced I came across an offer on their web site for $89 rooms, at that price it was good value. Service was good and location was fine, plenty of places to eat near the hotel circle. Pool was initially a bit chilly but it wasn't a particularly warm weekend in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: azanjall
Reviews.Content: We were worried of the choice we had made not knowing what it looked like or even the smell...But when we arrive the folks were helpful and friendly..I was very impressed with how clean the room was and especially the how clean the sheets smelled..When they offer a non -smoking room that is is just what it was.. The freeway access was close to every amenity needed..Seaworld the beach the mall,any restruant you could think of..We will difiently stay @ this hotel again.. Thanks for making a much needed vacation a comfortable success..

Reviews.Title: “Find Another Place”
Reviews.Author: mtnrain
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place I have ever stayed at, and I travel often. I did not recieve the accomodations I paid for, and even had to pay extra. So, if you are using a "third party" to book your reservation, it may not be what you receive. According to the front desk, only the reservations booked direct are guaranteed. The parking is limited and tight, if you have a large vehicle, good luck. A couple of nights we were unable to find parking due to Pick Ups taking too much space. I paid for a cot and the room was very crowded as it presented a hazard, in case we needed to access the door in a hurry. I did submit a letter to the hotel and I have not received a response, which leads me to believe that they are unconcerned with negative correspondence. I would not recommend this hotel, they are many more for the same price and better service, as I found out on another recent trip.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: Cinnie02
Reviews.Content: For some reason I was thinking this would be more of a hotel experience but, as the previous reviewer states, it is a motel with little frills. We were on the second floor so we weren't close too the parking noise but we did hear our upstairs neighbors walking. I felt bad for the neighbors below as we traveled with our 3 children so having them walk quietly was a challenge. We got a 2 queen room with a kitchenette. The beds were comfortable, and the small kitchen area was appreciated. The kitchen had a small 2 burner stove, with a mini fridge and small mircrowave. It was nice to have the silverware and dishes provided as well. Just wish they had provided more than just 3 of each with a family of 5. We had to have the kids eat first, then dish ourselves up. But we managed. The pool was nice and we did take advantage of that during our trip. The kids really enjoyed going during the weekend to attend the pool side movie they played. My only compliant is I wish they played the movie a little earlier. It didnt start till 830pm so wasn't over until close to 10pm. My younger two passed out both nights around 9pm so it wasn't worth it for them. And I have to agree, the resturaunt was not very good at all. We went because kids eat free so thought we would give it a try. The food wasn't very good and when we got our bill, were upset to find out that the Happy Hour specials were not combinable with the Kids Eat Free specials. The waiter or the flyer for the Happy Hour specials never mentioned this so we ended up paying full price instead. I don't know if I would stay at this hotel again. It's a great place if you don't plan on staying in your hotel at all except to sleep. With 3 young children, I think it was a little too cramped for us.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sofier
Reviews.Content: WAS PICKED UP AT AIRPORT ON TIME!!(WHICH IS HARD TO FIND IN SOME HOTEL?? rich was the driver he helped with every thing!!!! thank you ,clean hotel, shuttle driver was soooo good to my parents took them to eat. picked them up and next day took them to sea world thank you so much again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Two worlds here”
Reviews.Author: stewii
Reviews.Content: Make sure you know there are two wings. The newer wing is probably very nice. We stayed in the older wing which was quite worn down, and was not great. Service was pretty good, though. The Bathroom needs renos and my biggest pet peeve, the kitchenette has an old carpet that was sticky.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CowboyKermit
Reviews.Content: The shuttle to pick us up from the airport took over half an hour due to some mix up and they did not bother taking our cell phone number so they could contact us. Otherwise it's only 15 minutes away. It is quite busy during check-in around 4pm when we arrived. Took about 25 minutes, but staff was friendly and accommodating. It can be somewhat noisy depending on which side of the building you are on. Free parking, but don't forget to display the pass you get from front desk. High speed wireless Internet was a bit slow at times.

Reviews.Title: “Comic Con 2010”
Reviews.Author: CinDenver_46
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the reviews left by others .We stayed here while attending comic con. The price was great ! We call the week before to see if they would hold the luggage.we got in at 10am and they let us check in early. What a plus! The rooms were clean and the beds and pillows were wonder to sleep in. They leave extra beach towels for you. We used the sauna almost everyday! It is a 15 min walk to the trolley. I would have like to have had a shuttle to the trolley durning comic con but we did get a ride to the airport and train station which save us money. Also I would not recommend to order any food from the flyers that are slipped in the doors from local deliveries. We did and it was bad. Call pizza hut. That was the only bad experience we had, which wasn't the hotels fault. I would stay there again! and just may. We love San Diego! I would Recommend the the hotel! Thanks Everyone there for making our first Comic Con a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, service and location”
Reviews.Author: feltone
Reviews.Content: The price was right and also made available for purchase discount tickets and transpertation to the zoo and Sea World. The front desk was tremendously helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, comfortable room, a real surprise.”
Reviews.Author: KrazyKrem
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a conference at the Town and Country. I opted to stay at the Days Hotel across the street and was pleasantly surprised. The room was comfortable, the service was friendly and overall, I could find no major complaint with the hotel itself (in fact, the flat screen TV in the room was a pleasant surprise). This is a great, no-frills hotel for longer trips. If you are going to attend a conference at the Town and Country, the Days Hotel is a much better value than the conference center and is very conveniently located. While the Days chain has some spotty places elsewhere, the fact that they call it the Days Hotel instead of the Days Inn I think implies the positive difference. If you are visiting for vacation, this hotel will be fine as a base of operations but it is not exceedingly close to anything. You would certainly have to drive to the zoo, Sea World, downtown, etc. In that sense, the location is a complaint, but for my needs it was excellent. As a counter, they have a free shuttle that not only runs to the airport, it also will take you other locations of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel if parking is a priority”
Reviews.Author: socobruja
Reviews.Content: The good: location (but there are SEVERAL other options), lots of pillows, The bad: very limited parking and small spaces (too cramped), small rooms, expensive, outdated decor and snack machines, staff not very accomodating, Overall feeling is that this is a cheap motel with an expensive price tag. You're better off at a Motel 6 because that's the feeling you get at this hotel. It's not bad if you're in desperate need of a place to stay but I wouldn't recommend it for a vacation stay, especially if you are traveling with extended family....everybody will have an opinion!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Hotel Circle”
Reviews.Author: jasminekayla
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at Days Inn was less then memorable. I have had my reservations since February and since that time; I have been asking questions making sure that I made the right choice in staying here instead of the Host hotel. My judgment has proven me wrong. My stay started on June 21. When I checked in at 1130pm, I advised that I would need the shuttle service tomorrow. One of my main questions that I continued to ask before my stay was questions about the shuttle. Even the week before we came, I received an email advising me about the shuttle and I emailed back asking if I needed to make reservations before my arrival. Ingrid, responded no do not worry about it you can do it when you arrive. Okay no problem. Now when I tell the agent I needed the shuttle at 145 and 730 he states, it only runs every two hours and there is no room on the 730. Never once was I told that the shuttle runs on certain hours and I was told not to worry about shuttle reservations. He further proceeded to tell me I could stand on the shuttle. I have two children with me that are under 10 years old. How safe would it be for them to stand? We took our chances and caught the 730 without standing. However, the driver was almost 15 minutes late! If we were 15 minutes, late the shuttle would have left without us. The room. That is a sad model of your hotel. We first were in 351 but after I complained, we moved to 130. The problems with 351. The bathroom door would not open or shut. I finally had enough when my 7 year old was stuck in the bathroom. The crack under the door was so large I could see outside lights through the bottom of the door. My kids had a great time slipping papers back in forth underneath the door. Same problem with 130.The toilet constantly ran. I advised the agent of these issues and he stated he would put in a work request. The next day we were gone from appx 930 to 630 and the repairs were not completed. After that, I requested a room change and moved to 130. In that room, the issues were the door and the mold in the shower. By that time I was so frustrated I just gave up. At the restaurant, I was charged for my children every breakfast that we ate there. According to the email that I received, it states Kids Eat Free at Breakfast, Lunch, or Dinner at the Pam Pam Café and Grill! Children 12 and under receive one free kid's meal from the Children's Menu with each adult entrée and beverage purchased. Why was I charged? Isn’t that false advertising? On my departure, my flight had changed and I spoke with the agent to change the shuttle. I told her that I needed to be at the airport by 7:10 and I knew the shuttle only ran every 2 hours but if it didn’t have anyone else at 6 or 8 could they possibly take me. I was told no. No explanation straight out no. Fine I reserved a taxi and that was that. The next morning on my check out, I saw the shuttle sitting there even thought I was told they could not make an exception for me. My taxi arrived and off I went. I had friends still at the hotel and I called them at 8:00am and asked them to go see if the shuttle was still there and it was. Instead of offering a courtesy since I had prior issues with my stay, I had to spend $ 25.00 on a ride to the airport that should have been free. Overall, my stay was one of the worst that I have ever experienced. With my daughter on gymnastics, we stay at numerous ones throughout the year and if I ever end up back in San Diego, I will make sure to avoid this hotel at all costs. I truly believe my entire stay should be refunded because of this experience. They responded with a run of the mill answer and never reimbursed me even though I had written proof. Filing claim with BBB. Gave them a chance to make it better and all I got was sorry this will help us improve

Reviews.Title: “Good and not so good, for different reasons”
Reviews.Author: Lisadarlene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to the Days Hotel as recommended by my brother and sister in law who travel to San Diego often and use this facility. We came to enjoy 8 days of vacation time after a busy seminar in Los Angeles. Here are the GOODS: The location is close to the main highway and good shopping sites such as Fashion Valley Mall and Mission Valley Mall (which I HIGHLY recommend for any fashionista who wants amazing deals...go to Loehman's outlet and Nordstrom's Off the Rack....prepare to spend a lot of money but on dirt cheap deals!). Parking is quite ample and FREE with a pass given by the hotel. There are MANY rooms and different wings to the hotel. This hotel is one of the few that offers a kitchenette which includes 2 hot burners, a good size fridge and 2 sinks...along with pots, pans, dishes and cutlery. They also provide soap but no sponge! The whirlpool is decent. NOT SO GOOD: There are elevators located at the far end of each building...which can be a walk away if you have a lot of suitcases. The rooms are very basic with extremely old furnishings and beds that are hard as rocks. Rooms with kitchenettes ONLY come with 2 queen beds which was a waste of space as it was just for my husband and myself. Both beds were equally terrible. Pillows were so old that you could literally roll them up in a small ball. The hotel advertises a heated pool and free internet...the pool was NOT heated-rather cold but your body temperature adjusted. One family had purposely booked the Days Hotel because of their "heated pool" but were disappointed. Even though it is quite sunny in San Diego, the initial walk in to the water is VERY cold. The pool is small but situated away from the hotels in a fenced area with excellent landscaping. Be prepared to have many kids jumping in the pool and splashing you in the face...there is a NO DIVING rule but the kids don't care and dive in anyways...constantly. The internet is free...which was the main reason we picked this hotel-however, from the get go our connection was terrible. We would either have to stand in the bathroom, in the tub to get a signal, or go outside our door...very inconvenient. The front desk were helpful in trying to get us connected with IT support...and offered us a chance to move rooms which was nice. We didn't want to haul around all of our stuff and chose to stay there. So be prepared that your internet connection is below par. The closet was TINY. Overall, this hotel is quite old even though it boasts itself as being "the best Days hotel in San Diego" which is probably untrue. The staff is quite nice and the location is EXCELLENT-very close to Sea World and always within 15 minutes of other hot spot areas. We also got an excellent deal through priceline where we only paid $69 a night for a kitchenette room...the normal price through other services was $109 a night which I would classify as a bit too extreme for an old style, very plain hotel. I wouldn't pay more than $75 a night for this place. If you want something cheap and don't care about the hard beds, small and old rooms (the bathroom always smelled like urine), and don't use internet...this hotel is good for you. In future, I may come back but not to spend more than a few days here. At least we had a cheaper price and the free parking/sub par internet to tide us over. There are many other hotels right near by, it would make sense to keep an eye out. I recommend this place for the CHEAP value...but you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: proudmarinemom14051
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value. It was very quiet and clean. It was in a good location and minutes to restaurants and attractions. It was a short drive west or north to beaches. The shuttle service is to specific locations (Sea World, Balboa Park) and good. The drivers were great about giving tips about attractions and restaurants. If you have an idea about your plans, make your shuttle reservations as soon as you can for the time you want. We were able to get an early time but it was just two of us. There is a stop for the Old Town Trolley in front of the hotel and I highly recommend that. We saw parts of San Diego which we never would have seen on our own. The Pam Pam Cafe had good food and was very reasonable. The front desk staff was very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price, own a small car..”
Reviews.Author: MTXRooster
Reviews.Content: I wanted to write up a small ditty on this place. I'm not sure what the qualification between Days Inn & Suites and Hotel is exactly, up till we got there, I had no idea they were affialiated at all, but there were hints all over - similar logo, actualy pamphlets of Days Inn lurking about, etc.. Regardless, we chose this hotel because we got a deal through work for it - And when your family is big enough that two rooms are a requirement and you plan on staying multiple nights, that is a good thing. I did read up, on this site, actually about it prior to booking, and decided it was worth the value. Our first night there (Friday) we arrived about 30 minutes before check-in, though it wasn't a problem at all. We booked 1 room with the mini-kitchen, one without, and got what we expected, though one of the TV's would not 'function' with the remote (remote DID work in the other room, so it wasn't the remote) - but we didn't care enough to complain - Watching tv isn't what brought us to San Diego.. When we returned Saturday night, however, because we arrived back in the hotel between midnight and 1am, the hotel reared it's ugly head, as a previous poster said, and was the main reason for my post. Previous poster wasn't kidding when they said not a large vehicle friendly place. We have an extended Expedition, and while I had no problem on Friday, because all the 'regular' parking spots (in front of the rooms) we vacant it was a non-issue, fit right in - But Saturday night, in the dead of night, I found NOTHING I could fit in. Yes, there were about 4 spots open, and if I was travelling by myself in a sub-compact miniCooper, I might've fit in. So large/wide/big/long vehicle owners take note - You will NOT want to arrive after everyone else. Now the good part. A security guard, I believe, was VERY helpful at getting me parked. He saw me drive around 2-3 times and later stopped me and had me meet him by the entrance. He 'created' a parking spot for me up by the front - I say created because it's the best way to describe it :) I'm no fool, and there was no actual spot there, but he chizzled me into an unmarked space that was deep enough (kinda over some of the foilage) that I didn't stick out enough to be a target bumper for the 1st person not paying attention. I truly thank that gentleman for his assistance and only wish it wasn't 1am so I could have gotten his name. Ironically, there were a few more he had to tend to after me, and whoever the employee from inside was that he dragged out of the office, well that fellow must've had a spot in the lot, because the two were bickering about the employee needing to move his car out of the spots to free them up, and he was unwilling. Another big plus. Admittedly the rooms weren't the greatest (I suspect this is what gives the place the "Hotel" name as opposed to "Inn" in the Days food chain - But we didn't mind - When you are getting a hotel at a fair price less then most others, you just kind of assume "room quality" is why - And there was nothing to complain about, mind you - but nothing to brag about either. Except, that is.. for the outside area. The outdoor pool and hot tub were both nice, encased in a mini-outdoor paradise. It was well landscaped and really was a shining star. As if that wasn't enough, they had a 'to-order' BBQ grill going, with decent food and decent prices - Something rare! AND... Although we missed Saturday's feature, on Friday and Saturday, they play movies out there by the pool as well. Probably on a 70-90 inch projector, it was a good size, well viewable by all. I don't know who's idea that whole area is or was, but they deserve a raise. We've been to San Diego may a time (and elsewhere) and stayed at many different 'level' of hotel - This was really nice. While the parking bugged me, it was NOT a deal breaker. I knew thanks to this site it might be an issue - But they DID assist me and get me parked somewhere. (though in the morning, when a few cars left, I did scurry down there and move to a 'regular' spot pretty quick, for fear of being banged into by one of those other cars I was next to, not the same spacing as you find in the lined regular parking lot area). Factoring the pros and the cons, I'd stay there again, though I will watch my time on returning at night, for fear of missing the night that helpful gentleman works. :)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: vikingsfantwincities
Reviews.Content: The room we initially had was disgusting. Moldy shower curtain, old beds, and a musty smell. Fortunately, staff was able to move my family to the "business" traveler area by the pool. The gal at the front desk smirked when I said i wanted a room like the pictures on the internet....wonder how many times they have heard that one?? Although our new room was better, it was not what I would call comfortable or clean. I would not stay here again even if the rooms were free.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, Accommodating Service”
Reviews.Author: robeaj
Reviews.Content: Myself and two friends chose this Days Hotel after extensively researching the options in the San Diego area. We were looking for a great value, clean, comfortable rooms, and great service for a stay of 5 nights/6 days. Boy did we find it! The front desk staff were always helpful in answering our many, many questions about the area and the shuttle drivers should be commended for their friendliness and flexibility. Even when looking to go to areas that weren't noted as specific shuttle locations (Old Town, nearby Fashion Valley Mall), they still offered to take and pick us up as their schedules allowed. For those worried about the WiFi availability, I didn't have a single problem with it whatsoever (and was located in the middle of the 2nd floor). I was taking an online class that extended through our stay and needed to submit daily assignments, as well as take a 2-hour exam one of the days. The connection was always stable, as well as the speed, even during peak traffic times such as the evening. I was actually quite surprised by this as some of the reviews speak negatively of the availability. This was the only location I accessed it from, however, so I can't be quick to say that I would have been just as lucky in other areas of the property. They also offer a wireless printing service, but I never personally used it. Overall, it was a fantastic experience. I feel as though people are often to quick to complain, as if they're specifically searching for flaws in the first place. In my experience with numerous hotel stays in the past, I would have to say this has been one of the best. Yes, the property is in need of a few renovations, but you'll find few hotels that aren't these days for such a great value! The pillows are soft, the rooms are very clean, and the staff always greeted us with a smile and a helpful answer.

Reviews.Title: “Great rates, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: rlemire
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. We were skeptic on the room at first, but after we started to unpack everything was comfortable. The service was great and everyone we spoke to were extremely polite and easy to talk to. Whether it be the bell desk, house keepers, and shuttle drivers they were all great. We enjoyed the location, it wasn't as busy as we thought it may be. We really enjoyed the pool and especially on the weekends when they served food. It was a decent price and a nice weekend night to sit at the pool and have some food. The only thing we would probably dislike would be we had a room below one of their restaurant. It wasn't extremely noisy, but once in awhile you could hear things moving around below. The restaurant itself was really good food and we are normally picky on what we eat. I would highly recommend to anyone visiting the San Diego area to try and take a look at this place first. Days Inn Hotel Circle made our trip very comfortable as we were already nervous for our first big trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but never again”
Reviews.Author: seekingcoolerweather
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently after reading other TA reviews. The price and location were both good so we gave it a shot. The rooms were OK- clean and functional. The pool area was very nice. The parking.....well let's just say that the parking lot is for small cars. Very small cars. It was a very tight squeeze to drive through the parking lot aisles between cars at night. And most of the vehicles were average size, not huge. It was very difficult to find parking anywhere close to the room unless we got back to the room by 5pm and didn't didn't leave again. The service- well even though the room was a good value we expected friendly service. It was truly hit or miss. Some front desk interactions were friendly; others were frustrating. We had friends that also stayed in this hotel and they went to breakfast at the diner because they were told that kids eat free with a paying adult. When they got their bill and realized they had been charged for the kid's meal, they were told (rudely) that this policy did not apply to breakfast. That would have been nice to know before! We had to request items from housekeeping several times and it was usually because they missed it when straightening the room. We had to go to the desk twice in 1 week for toilet paper because they never left it in the room...even if we had less than 1/2 a roll. Overall, I think their communication was off. I kept trying to overlook most of this by reminding myself of the great rate. In the end, it was a $10 parking charge that made me say "never again". Our parking pass flew out an open car window while driving, so we were charged $10 (per day) to replace it. Thank goodness it was our last night there, or I would have left anyways. I understand the charge is stated on the pass, but that $10 charge seems like an insult....charging us to circle the lot 5 times before finally finding a spot 2 buildings over. Very disappointed that they weren't interested in pleasing a customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great price and the great staff makes this place a best buy!”
Reviews.Author: mattielanb7
Reviews.Content: The five of us certainly enjoyed our stay at the Days Hotel Circle. We were there for seven nights and were treated wonderfully. The front desk people were polite and extremely helpful. This hotel provides free shuttles to and from the airport, Sea World, and the Zoo. Who can argue with comfortable, convenient, free transportation to the biggest attractions the city has to offer? The shuttle drivers were also courteous and helpful to us 'tourists.' The ladies that cleaned the room deserve an award. Imagine how much "stuff" five people had with them for an 8 day/7 night trip! Yet, they persevered, and performed miracles every day. The hotel also has free Wi-Fi, a public computer in their lobby, and a beautiful, sparkling pool area. Negatives? The front desk could use extra personnel on duty, especially during the busy check-out times. And the Hotel Circle area needs restaurant choices outside the hotel's restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “great place but Zero quality for wifi speed”
Reviews.Author: mrfusilli2005
Reviews.Content: everything about the hotel is fantastic for someone who don't drive and needs a stove to cook breakfasts on. one big downfall I find is the wifi speed is so poor that I gave up trying many times on my iPod. it gets so bad, I can't even get my own emails for about 10 minutes. sometimes, you can't even log on. what I do is don't bother using wifi at the hotel, just use the free wifi at Fashion valley mall instead. As for everything else, amazing the clean staff even does the odd dish or two for you if you got the 2 queen kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Room needs some work but overall an okay stay.”
Reviews.Author: tomf4195
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based on previous ratings by travelers. I guess I was expecting a little more from the reviews that I had read but I was a little disappointed. The room wasn't bad but it was average at best. It needs to be renovated. The bathroom grout had mold stains and when we first entered the bathroom and the tub had several left over hairs from the previous guests. The sliding door does not lock for the bathroom. If you are not looking for a very clean and renovated hotel, this is your place. It was ok for the money but I probably wouldn't recommend or stay here if I come back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “fabulously comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: MSUgirl727
Reviews.Content: compared to a "higher" rated hotel we were forced to stay in due to missing a flight connection for a diversion....Days Hotel has by far the most COMFY beds! My boyfriend slept the best he's slept in YEARS ( even home, which is good seeing we were on a 3 night vaca, but bad since we just bought a new bed)! Super friendly staff, great option to have shuttle service (even if limited times and fill up fast). Pool area was pretty well landscaped to give a nicer feel to the location. tile outside bathroom was a bit "sticky" and carpet could use a really good shampoo. but other than that...great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, Friendly Staff, Good amenities .”
Reviews.Author: Jray29
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at this Days Hotel. I enjoyed the movie by the pool, it was something different rather than staying in my room that night. Everyone that works here is really friendly and had no problem helping you out with anything.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel but good value”
Reviews.Author: OH_Tom
Reviews.Content: We spent almost a week at the Days Hotel on Hotel Circle. We chose Days Hotel because it offered the best value for the nightly rate. First things first: If you are looking for a luxury room with a luxury price, look elsewhere. There are several luxury hotels and resorts nearby where the room rate will be much higher and you will pay even more for parking and Internet access. The Days Hotel is conveniently located--it is minutes away from downtown San Diego, Old Town San Diego, Sea World, the zoo, Balboa Park, Belmont Park, and other local attractions. It is located right beside busy Interstate 8; however, we had a room near the front of the building and did not notice any highway noise. The Days Hotel is an older hotel but the rooms have been renovated. We opted for the kitchenette room. The room was a standard (not oversized) two-bed hotel room with a small self-contained stainless steel cooking unit in the dressing area. The cooking unit has a sink, a two element electric cooktop, and a medium-sized dorm refrigerator. There was a microwave oven on the dressing area countertop. Above the kitchenette unit was a cabinet with a skillet, large saucepan, plates, cups, and silverware. The kitchenette was conveniently stocked with dish detergent, a sealed sponge, a dish cloth, and a dish towel. The kitchenette seemed like a good idea when we booked the room; however, we ended up only using the microwave and refrigerator. With two adults, two children, and our luggage in the room, space was rather tight and the room just wasn't big enough to allow us to have a serious meal. If a microwave and refrigerator are included in a standard room, we would skip the kitchenette option if we stay there again. The room itself felt very clean, although the carpet (particularly near the door) could certainly use a deep cleaning. The sheer curtains were very dirty where the air from the air conditioning unit blew on them. The bathroom and dressing area seemed very clean. The shower surround, bathroom floor, and dressing area floor had been updated with modern tile and they were spotless. However, the pocket door between the bathroom and dressing area seemed ancient and it did not operate smoothly. The beds were clean and comfortable--we especially appreciated the way they sandwich the blanket between two sheets. Overall, we didn't have any significant concerns about cleanliness. My wife is rather sensitive to cleanliness and she felt our room was quite acceptable. The hotel has a very nice heated pool and a hot tub at the back of the property. Our children were quite pleased with the pool, even though it was too cold for my wife and me to venture in. We were staying at the hotel at an extremely busy time and the (free) parking lot can get full. If you are renting a car, you might want to avoid the giant SUV or Crown Victoria. Some previous reviewers had mentioned this and it proved to be very accurate. Also remember that you can only park one car at the hotel--this was not a problem for us. Regarding the service, we did not experience any of the unfriendliness reported in some of the reviews. The maintenance staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The friendliness of the front desk staff was about average. One of the nicest things about this hotel is their shuttle service to major points of interest, including Sea World, the zoo, and other attractions. You MUST sign up for the shuttle and space is limited, so check their schedule and sign up early. Even though some reviewers have criticized the shuttle service because of the need to sign up early, it still seemed like a valuable benefit to us. You can also conveniently purchase tickets to attractions at the front desk; however, we were able to beat their prices by using our AAA discount or Internet coupons. Be sure to do your research before you leave home. Overall, we were happy with our stay at Days Hotel. Some of our friends stayed at a nearby resort at twice the nightly rate (plus optional parking and Internet). They saw our room and said their room was not significantly better. The resort had no shuttle service whatsoever and their front desk recommended calling a cab or taking mass transit. We had originally considered staying at the resort and felt quite vindicated having chosen Days Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are surprisingly comfy”
Reviews.Author: jeromepablo
Reviews.Content: I was reluctant to use this hotel after reading some of the reviews but took my chances, I am glad I did, it didn't smell, the beds were comfy and the staff was friendly and informative. If you plan on using the shuttle service though I would book the time at the same time you book your room as the spots fill up fast, and why wouldn't they, it is free. The only real negative thing I have to say is about the PAM PAM cafe, we had breakfast there our first morning, what a mistake. The food was horrible and the staff was RUDE. Days Hotel should be ashamed of this place. We got a buy one adult breakfast and get the kids free deal through the internet booking process as did several other guests. Pam Pam staff did not honer the deal, they told other patrons that they were misinformed by the hotel. My wife went to the hotel to let them know what was going on and we eventually got the three free meals but the others just paid for them. I plan on going back to San Diego before the year is up and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcome start to family vactation”
Reviews.Author: keano44
Reviews.Content: Well to be honest the reason we picked this hotel in the first place was because of the reviews but we were terribly shocked. Staff seemed nice at first but that changed, when we got into our room the first thing we noticed was the musty smell, then the broken lock, the the paint peeling from the bathroom sliding door, then the towel hook that was hanging upside down very loose. During the night the ac was so loud we had to turn it off for a while, at about 3am I heard people laughing outside thge room and the traffic was so loud I think the walls must have been made of paper it was terrible. I almost forgot early in the evening we went out for some food when we came back we could not find one parking space anywhere we managed to find a spot that we were not sure if it was a space so we called the desk and the guy was so rude to my wife it was not acceptable. They told my wife that there was spots available but they were not near our room and then my wife waited 15minutes while 4 other people came in looking for spots also, they told my wife that if our car was to be moved then in the middle of the night we would have a knock on our door from a security guard and that we might receive a fine. After 15 minutes they told my wife to go back upstairs to our room that the car should be ok were it was. In the end a very disappointing stay and we went elsewhere the next day.Also in the morning I FORGOT TO MENTION a huge gap under the door it was so bright a3" gap unbelievable plus the bathroom light was on a timer...never again..

Reviews.Title: “Sad Room”
Reviews.Author: bluekaz
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit perplexed by all of the favorable reviews of this place. I was hoping for a decent room (not fancy) at a reasonable price. What I found was a beat up room. The furniture was very scuffed up and our bathtub was peeling. Our room sure didn't seem to have been updated. I would not describe the room as being pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PILLOWS ANY WHERE!”
Reviews.Author: BonnieNelsonMcGinn
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel very much. It is a great place to stay for the money. Rooms were very clean and newly remodeled. We were very surprised to have a fridge and also a microwave in the rooms concidering what we were paying. The best thing for me were the wonderful pillows! I have a hard time sleeping at home. I slept like a baby with those pillows! We even asked if we could purchase some pillows before checking out. The manager was so nice he checked with housekeeping to see which kind we had in our room. We were able to purchase 2 new pillows. I wish I had purchased 4, but will be back some time again. I now sleep good at home and tell friends about these great pillows. They will stay in the same hotel when ever they are traveling to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly, Convenient and Affordable!”
Reviews.Author: Mom0315
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been a favorite of my family for several years. We always stay here when we go to Sea World. It is clean, comfortable and the staff is very accomodating. The Pam Pam Cafe has great breakfast. The fact that kids under 12 eat free with a paying adult is even better!

Reviews.Title: “Dampen on the trip To San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: ellasyn
Reviews.Content: People at front desk are extremely rude. There is a shopping centre about 15 minutes walk, which has a JCPenny, Macy's etc... Nothing else near by, unless you have a car or are willing to pay for taxi's. The rooms we were staying in stunk of urine. The service here was horrible, including the people on breakfast shift at the Diner. One of the reasons we booked this hotel was because of the "continental breakfast" it came with. Be warned, a continental breakfast here is a bagel or toast and a coffee (different to where I come from where a continental usually means cereal, toast, fruit, yoghurt etc).

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Hotel restaurant was great.”
Reviews.Author: socal555
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was clean. Location was great. Didn't even have to get on the interstate to get to great places like Old Town and the mall. This was a relocation stay. We were so exhausted at the end of the day from moving that we didn't even want to leave the hotel once we got there each evening. So we ate at the hotel restaurant every night. The food was good and hot. I think we had everything on the menu. (We ate breakfast once, too.) The kids ate free, so that helped on the cost. We were even able to get a latte first thing in the morning. The bed was comfortable. Lots of pillows. If you are taking a nap, put the sign on the door, and if housekeeping has not come yet, they will leave the fresh towels in a bag on the door. Then the hotel shuttle took us to the airport to catch our plane. Can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay.”
Reviews.Author: JPOC
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent value for money, the rooms were huge, clean and very comfortable. I did read that some people had issues with the air con, basically set your temp and then leave it for about ten minutes....presto! The hotel also has an excellent pool area which includes a good size hot tub and complimentary towels. Breakfast is not included but there is an on site restaurant serving nice food.

Reviews.Title: “we love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bobobunny
Reviews.Content: we love this hotel. we had reservations at another hotel right next door to start with. we ended up checking out of that hotel the next morning and going to the days hotel. we will be back next year and will stay with them again. thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price,good shuttle service,walking distance to mall”
Reviews.Author: whitecat33
Reviews.Content: We had one teenager with us, our 16yr old grandson. Pool was a lovely setting for him. The shuttle drivers were really nice people, prompt pick-up at airport. No charge for any of the trips. We went to the zoo and the cruise terminal. A mini store was a few doors down, we were able to buy wine and snack food items there. We also walked a short distance to the mall, across the street. Service was fine, room was clean and comfy. Great hotel for the price, better than we expected

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with a great bunch of staff”
Reviews.Author: Shellya23
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was great in every aspect! free pickup from the airport to the hotel, free shuttle to sea world (5minute drive) free shuttle to the zoo and with in walking distance to a large mall. Also very close to the harbour where you can take in all the sights (old ships to walk through including a naval aircraft carrier, harbour tours, a short boat ride over to Coronado which has a nice little beach for the kids to play at, as well as some neat shops and good food. The staff was very friendly at the front desk, shuttle drivers, cleaning staff and at Pam Pam restaurant which is right on site with great food as well. The pool is a bit small but still great for our 3 and 7 year old girls. This was our secend visit to this hotel and would not hesitate to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: jasmine_paul
Reviews.Content: Hotel was walking distance to big shopping centre and from there there was a train to town. There was a computer in the lobby with free internet. Room was clean and quite roomy. There was a pool but i didnt use it as it was too cold. Had a nice dinner at the restaurant one night and also had takeaway breakfast from there. We also went to servo for snacks which was a few metres down the street. The hotel also has a free shuttle to zoo & sea world. Zoo was a bit average but Sea World was amazing loved it! Killer whale show was great. Did a day trip to Tijuana Mexico wouldnt recommend that it was awful army driving round with big guns on back of trucks it was scary and not worth the time as the shopping wasnt that great all though we did get free shots of tequilla!!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Service that I have experienced”
Reviews.Author: gmo42
Reviews.Content: From first contact, this organization had the best customer service that I have witnessed as a hotel customer. the staff went out of their way to make sure your stay was pleasurable. I traveled with a big group of high school students and we needed many rooms. Not only were they able to accomodate us, but they also had our rooms ready upon our arrival, which was three hours before check in. The hotel staff made our trip to San Diego a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and shuttle service if you are visiting Sea World”
Reviews.Author: wmarti31
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend there. Perfect location if you are going to Sea World. The only issue we had was that we were Downtown a late afternoon/early evening, and called the hotel to see if the shuttle could quickly deviate from its routes and give us a ride to the hotel. They told us they could, but that the shuttles were busy with trips to the airport, SeaWorld, the ship terminal, etc., and that we would have to wait 2-3 hours because they could not deviate. We decided to not wait and took a taxi, and when we arrived at the hotel both vans were parked there and the drivers were at the restaurant just hanging out. I did not like this B.S. I would have understood had they told me that they could not pick us up simply because it is a service that they do not provide. I did not like that they were going to make us wait 2-3 hours, and perhaps say no after being waiting for them for 3 hours in Downtown San Diego, when they could have say no since the beginning. Besides this, everything was fine with the hotel and their service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: AusVince
Reviews.Content: Spent a night here while visiting the Giant Dipper at Belmont Park. Room was clean but most importantly, I slept well on the mattress. Best rate I found in the area. Wireless signal was fine.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Picky123
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was absolutely amazing! You felt like you were their most important guest although the place was at capacity. i could not have asked for better service no matter what we needed. Toilet did stop up once but even at 10:00 pm, maintenance showed up in less than 10 minutes and was done in just 2 minutes and was extremely friendly. Quiet, spotless room. Great location. Perfect price. Slept fantastic - great beds/pillows. Easy access to public transportation, trolley tour (highly recommend for first time visitors) and the hotel had fantastic, complimentary shuttle. The shuttle drivers went above and beyond for us and we so appreciated it. We visited for Marine Corps graduation and stayed at this hotel based on the price as well as the reviews. Was skeptical because of price but the great reviews I read were all TRUE! Wonderful pool and hot tub with beautiful landscaping around. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Maybe if we'd had a better room...”
Reviews.Author: BB85Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April for a few nights and checked out early becuase we couldn't stand our room! Looking at the pictures on this website, I have to say "where are these rooms in the pictures?" Our room was nothing like these, we had a room that faced out onto the middle courtyard leading up to the pool and it was not great. Had a big noisy window air conditioner (none of the rooms in the pictures seem to have these!) and smelled stale and old, could see daylight through the gaps in the sides of the door into the room. Maybe we got an old or un-renovated room... but we also found hairs on the pillow and on one of the towels, then the next morning, found more hair on the pillow again, after housekeeping had been in. That was when we decided to look elsewhere. Room did have a big bar fridge and a microwave, and an in-room safe. Pool was nice, got cold fast because the big trees block all the sun, and no towels at the pool! Very slow elevator. Couldn't get on the computer in the office since one person was monopolizing it for over half an hour even though front desk said there is a time limit for use, obviously not enforced. Free internet service in the rooms though. Shuttle service for sea world runs only twice a day, but shuttle did pick us up about half an hour after we called from the nearby mall. Not very convenient airport shuttle service though unless you want to be there at 8 am. Maybe if we had gotten a better room, we would have had a better experience, but based on what we got, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: GGinMtzCa
Reviews.Content: The place is decent for the price and the staff is friendly. I didn't mind the look of this place since we were out all day and just used it to sleep before heading to the next theme park. They have a microwave and small fridge and they even leave you a bottle water, granola bar and popcorn. I thought that was nice. The other great thing was the free parking and free shuttle bus service although the zoo has free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Even though - would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: LovedMyHolidays
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine - you are there to do the sights not spend the day in the room so on that note it was perfect. Location was EXCELLENT - walking to Fashion Valley - old Town Trolley (which I highly recommend) stop right out front, family type restaurant on site - heated pool. Staff was very friendly. Only complaint - their 'free shuttle' service- while it IS free - it was NOT on time ever. Be it 15 minutes to 35 minutes late - you could count on it being late - and this is the pre booked shuttles. The most distressing was departure - had to be at airport 2 hours early for an international flight at noon. Was told to take the 10am shuttle - would be there by 10:15 - the shuttle didn't even leave the hotel until 10:35! Then it made another stop first before heading to the airport. Still managed to clear customs and make the flight - but very stressful - if you want the 10am shuttle for the airport - book the 8am one!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: nvmomof2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 days and 4 nights with our children. It was a great value and a perfect location. It is very close to Old Town and Sea World and the beaches. We would definitely stay here again. The pool was nice and the hotel is very quiet. The restaurant is nice too but at times the service was not the best. The food was always delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mater2006
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Days Hotel for four days in the business class room. The rooms were great. My son especially enjoyed the feather pillows on the bed and daily snacks that were left. The rooms were cleaned nicely each day without problem. The hotel was packed each day, but we were still able to find decent parking. The staff was great too. I will definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Pick someplace else!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelerWI
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Days Inn with my teenage daughter for spring break. This is the worse Days Inn I ever stayed at and it really put a damper on my first vacation to San Diego. The "free" shuttle service is not reliable and not available. I had to pay a taxi to get to the hotel unless I wanted to wait 2 hrs for the shuttle after my flight arrived. However, I couldn't make a reservation for the shuttle - you can only call when you arrive. They have multiple vehicles available but only 1 driver. Seriously?? Our room was never cleaned until 5pm which was a huge inconvenience. This hotel was extremely loud - walls are paper thin and you can hear everything that is going on in the next rooms as well as the floor above you. The Pam Pam restaurant is slow and has horrible food. The best part was the proximity to the Trolley shuttle (but it also stops at other hotels, so that's not a plus). Pool claimed to be heated but was very cold water. There is one ice machine for the whole building in the back and it is outside and inconvenient. All around just a horrible experience. Checked out some other places for the future that were around the same price...try Courtyard at Marriott (still within shuttle walking distance). Comfort Inn by Mission Valley (very nice - same price).

Reviews.Title: “ALWAYS A GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: tripladyWA
Reviews.Content: I can't count the number of times I have stayed here over the last 5 years. I travel with individuals with disabilities and the people, the service, the accommodations, the amenities, keep me coming back. The hotel is clean and rooms comfortable. The location is great - especially with their complimentary shuttle to places like SeaWorld and the Zoo. The staff (from the front desk, to housekeeping, to shuttle drivers) are top notch!! Can't say enough positive!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: MPLSguy78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. The good- Clean, comfortable beds, HBO, shuttle bus to Sea World, free parking, close to a shopping mall. The bad- Ice machines can be a hike to get to, the bed would shake when someone walked by the room, small bathroom. Overall this hotel worked for what we needed. Pool and hot tub were both open.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel in A Good Location...”
Reviews.Author: tboandspit
Reviews.Content: We were happy with everything this hotel had to offer. The service was pretty pitiful when checking in and out, however I guess it was spring break. They had booking issues and we were given a room with two kings rather than one queen. The hotel rooms were large and clean and well maintained. Housekeeping were there till late hours so the hotel was always well kept. The pool and spa area were great, and we found this good as it was our relaxing time. There was an on-site restaurant, however it closes at 9pm so we didn't really take advantage of it. This created a minor issue as for those wanting a quick bite late at night there is little close by. We took advantage of the free shuttle to Seaworld!! Saved our gas!! Hotel Circle is a good area to stay, close to downtown and freeways. No real complaints about this hotel really, I think value for money was pretty outstanding!! Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: foolosopher
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we've been to San Diego. Last time we stayed at a hotel on Shelter Island but this time we were on a budget. After reading many positive ratings here, I've decided to book a room with kitchenette for a few days we stay in San Diego. Pros: We arrived right on time the hotel allows to check in, the receptionist was a little cold but he was prompt and efficient. We did not wait long to enter our room. Our room was small but well managed. The table with 2 chairs are very useful for our diner - not very convenient to watch TV at the same time though. The cleaning ladies were very helpful with my request to have a new bottle of dish soap The location is great : close to everything we wanted to visit : the Zoo, Sea World, minutes to downtown and Cabrillo. I was in need of a new pair of jeans at 9PM to wear to the Zoo the next day, and Fashion valley mall is only 2 minutes driving away. Wi-fi is free, and slow but it was okay for our basic internet uses. It was very quiet at night. We had no problem sleeping and I am the kind of person who is very hard to sleep. Very fast check out Cons: The kitchenette was very small and not very convenient - located on the right of the toilette sink - so very cramped and no place to prepare the food prior to cooking. I do not like the sliding door of the toilette, it was very heavy at first and made me feel claustrophobic. The room was a little bit dusty in my opinion. I have sinusitis so my nose is very sensitive to dust. I coughed the whole night after touching the TV remote control. Pillows were hard and stiff. But it was my fault for being too lazy to call the reception. I will do it next time. Overall this hotel is a great value and I recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Close to everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: traveller2332
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal. Cheapest place we found with decent reviews. The room was great- the best of the Day's brand we have stayed in. So close to all the freeways going to nearby towns for dinner was super easy. Great transportation to Sea World and San Diego Zoo. Only downside is the fact that you do hear a lot of noise from the freeway. Didn't affect our stay. Also, if you aren't a fan of wild children running loose around the hotel - pick a different place - this one is popular with families

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sheldonking
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was halfway between the Zoo and Seaworld. Picked this hotel because of the positive reviews on here and they were right! We came from a cheap Super 8 by Disneyland and walking into our room at the Day's was like night and day with our former room. Very clean and nice room. Felt very comfortable the whole stay and the boy's loved the pool. Would highly recommend for anyone looking for a place to stay to visit the sights in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUSLY CLEAN, WONDERFUL SERVICE, GREAT ROOMS!”
Reviews.Author: dragonflies105
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just completed a 7-night stay at this property. The service of the staff and the cleanliness of this Days Hotel went far beyond my expectations. I am a neat freak (aka "germophobe") about hotel rooms and I must say that our room exceeded my expectations. Without a doubt, housekeeping definitely maintained our room in a manner you would expect at a super-expensive luxury hotel. The bedding and linens appeared new, they were bright white, crisp and fresh. The bathroom was immaculate and our kitchenette area was highly maintained. Given this hotel's location (within 10-15 mins. to all major attractions) and our experience here, I, confidently, can tell you that I will never stay anywhere else when visiting San Diego! Thank you Days Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, so so room”
Reviews.Author: SCCalifornia
Reviews.Content: LOVED the price, cannot be beat, and NO parking fee. I saved a lot of money staying here, but not sure I would stay again. The pillows (all 8 of them!) were so hard, I had a neck ache, and I like firm pillows. I requested softer pillows, but the ones delivered were the same as the ones we had. Room is decent, especially for the price, but a bit cheaply renovated. Someone had told me to request the Business section as those rooms are nices, which is where we were.

Reviews.Title: “Double the service at half the cost of the conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: frozenporklander
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to attend a conference that was being held at the nearby Town and Country Resort. All during the conference I heard complaints from the people that were staying at the conference hotel as they groused about the freeway noise, the extra costs for parking and wifi, the lack of a room fridge, and the puny television sets, all at $150 per night. Needless to say, they didn't like it too much when I would brag about the great service and the super deal I had at your hotel. I especially appreciated the free shuttle to and from the airport and that the front desk staff allowed me a late check out because my flight wasn't leaving until early evening. Thank you so much for an awesome stay!

Reviews.Title: “Reluctantly recommend”
Reviews.Author: RenoTahoeMom
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel, and reluctantly recommend it. I booked the upgraded, business class room with two queen beds for our family of five (two adults and three kids ages 5-9). This room is in the hotel's newest remodeled building and is the only building that opens to an interior corridor. All the other buildings open to an outside corridor. This building is also closest to the pool area, and comes with covered parking. The business rooms include snacks which I thought would come in handy with three kids. We did not get what we expected. First of all, the room was so small, there was no way a family of five could stay in this room. We were on top of each other the whole time. We always travel with an air mattress in case we run into situations like this, and it was good we had it. We had to rearrange furniture to fit the air mattress in. When I spoke to the front desk staff about the size of the room and how it was supposed to accomodate five people, she just apologized and offered to move us to a room with a kitchenette. This room was the same size so we did not switch. She said all their rooms were the same size. The kitchenette room, however, felt a LITTLE more roomy because the bathroom area was laid out differently and seemed to have more space, but the sleeping area was the same. As for the snacks in the room, they were a joke. The snacks were an 8 oz. bottle of water, a granola bar, and a microwave bag of popcorn. For the extra amount I was paying per night for this "upgrade," I could go to the grocery store and buy a lot more snacks than what they provided. As for the room, it was supposed to be newly renovated, but it did not look like it. The carpet was sticky in spots--you know the type of room where you end up putting all your used towels on the floor because you don't want to touch the floor with your bare feet. The bedding and mattress were fine, but the pillows were very uncomfortable. They were really thick and firm--not soft at all. It was better for me to sleep without a pillow, and this may be personal preference, but I did not sleep well for the two nights we stayed there. Everything in the room was older and did not look "renovated." The bathroom area was small as well. We were close to the pool which was nice. It was not noisy being closer to the pool which was a concern of mine. Bottom line, I would not pay the extra money to upgrade the room to the business class. It simply was not worth it. I told this to the front desk staff and they refunded the difference and just charged us the standard room rate. I was happy with this resolution. The staff at this hotel was very nice and accomodating. The pool and hot tub were quite nice and enjoyable. The area was clean. The restaurant, Pam Pam Cafe, was also nice, particularly the staff working there. We were always greeted with a smile and enthusiasm. The people seemed to enjoy what they were doing and it came through in their work attitude. The food was good too, typical diner fare. One other nice thing about this hotel was that parking was included, but the spots are small and tight (this may be a California thing). The parking is outdoor unless you are in the business class room which has covered parking--again not worth the extra money. There appeared to be plenty of parking spaces available. If you choose to stay at this hotel, don't pay extra for the business class room. If you have more than four in your party, you'll need two rooms in order to be comfortable. You might also want to bring your own pillow just in case, as well as a pair of slippers or flip flops to wear around the room.

Reviews.Title: “Quite happy at the Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: omalleycat_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Days Inn Hotel Circle January 5 - 13 2010 Location: Hotel Circle is just that, a huge circle of hotels and their restaurants on a busy road/freeway, not very scenic or within walking distance to much of interest. However the Fashion Valley Mall is 10-15 minutes walk away (there is a trolley station there too), there is a mini-mart/liquor store a few hotels down, and a bus stop outside the hotel. It doesn't take long to get to Seaworld, zoo etc by car or hotel shuttle. Hotel amenities/services: Computer with free internet access in reception was great. We absolutely loved the Pam Pam onsite restaurant, we ate there every night of our 8 night stay and several breakfasts as well. Children eat free with a paying adult. We thought the food selection was great, the prices reasonable, the atmosphere lovely and the staff mostly friendly and attentive ( we especially liked the lady who sometimes had her son in doing homework). TV in the corner if you want to watch sports. Free shuttle service is invaluable, there is only one service a day to each Seaworld and Zoo but it gets you there a few minutes before opening and picks up at closing (we found we needed the full days!) We did have a mix up on our last day of shuttle use, they agreed to take us down to the bayfront (not an official shuttle destination) and said 10AM. We went down to reception that morning to ask if they wanted to add us on to the Seaworld run instead of making a separate trip just for us but the driver said "No I won't be ready for you until 10.30" So at 10.20 we duly went down, the shuttle turned up soon after and the driver asked where we had been, he had waited for us at 10. He had definately said 10.30 (my husband and I both heard it clearly) but he insisted he had said 10. He called us a taxi which was nice, but my husband was unhappy and we wished we had just taken a taxi in the first place much earlier! However it is a free service and this was not an official destination so can't really hold this against the hotel. We had used shuttle for 5 days previously and it was very convenient with drivers helpfully making sure everyone knew what time pick up was. My husband was very keen to do the laundry once he discovered the seats and TV in the laundry room, he was most impressed with this! Room: We had a triple all-in-one room with kitchenette on 2nd level. Housekeeping standards were slightly lower than the other similarly priced hotels we stayed in while in the U.S (a few not quite clean pieces of kitchen equipment, bath could have been a bit cleaner , some little bits of paper on the floor in the corner of the room that were there on our arrival and still there on our departure) but this didn't detract from our stay.
