The girl at the front desk was VERY professional and helpful and had great customer service skills. In fact, her great personality would be about the only reason I'd book again at this hotel. It was just a little bit too much on the borderline of being awful.

Reviews.Title: “Free internet in hotel lobby!”
Reviews.Author: bargain
Reviews.Content: After staying for a week in Anaheim at a hotel that charged for internet usage, we were thrilled to find that the Days Inn Hotel Circle provided free internet and printing in their lobby. The restaurant on site - Pam Pam - provided us with very good service and the food was so good that we ate there every day (we stayed from Dec 3 - Dec 7, 2007)! We requested for a room upgrade (the room in the older part of the hotel smelt moldy) and were happy with our room in the newer building. The shuttle bus driver, Gerald or Jared (not sure which is correct...pardon my hearing), was friendly and gave the passengers helpful hints about places we were visiting. Overall, we had a pleasant stay. Front desk staff could be friendlier though.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great Days Inn Hotel Circle”
Reviews.Author: mumthetourist
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a little disappointing maybe due to the renovations taking place at the time. We found it quite a difficult place to find when driving and even the taxi driver went the wrong way. The shuttle to the zoo was good and the driver very helpful however they forgot to pick us up! They did refund us the taxi fare which was good of them. My husband went up to the spa/pool however it was half empty and green-maybe renovations? The rooms were clean and even had a microwave. We only had one night but probably wouldn't go back until renovations were completed. There was also free internet in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed immesurably”
Reviews.Author: snumps
Reviews.Content: During Christmas holidays in 2006, my husband and I stayed with our 3 year old son in this hotel. While the rooms were a little older looking, they were very clean. What impressed us, though, was the service. The people there went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The men running the shuttle buses, in particular, were very helpful and friendly. They would drive us, if they weren't busy, to other destinations (like the local mall), and would do extra runs for us to the main attractions (the zoo and Seaworld), again if they weren't busy. We have again this year decided to stay at the hotel. This year we are travelling with our 4 year old son and 10 month old daughter. I had questions about accomodating my daughter - she needs a crib - as well as some other questions. I e-mailed the hotel, and within 24 hours got a response back addressing my concerns. While I have not stayed there yet this season, I am confident that our stay will be just as enjoyable as the last one. While the rooms might be a little dated(but clean), the service is impeccable. I would highly recommend this hotel for your next stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn333
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Days Inn Hotel Circle for 6 nights before going on a cruise and 1 night after. Both times we booked a business class room, and both of our stays at this hotel were amazing. The property is newly renovated and is a great value. We got a discounted rate with our CAA membership, which was well spent! The rooms are clean, freshly remodeled, have new bedding, a large bathroom area (with the sink and counter area outside of where the toilet and shower are), have comfortable matresses and great, new bedding. There is free internet access in the hotel lobby, as well as staff to help you book tours and to provide information on attractions. Our room was cleaned and refreshed daily by mid-morning. We were able to check-in early during both arrivals without any difficulty. Everything about this hotel was fantastic and we would recommend it to travelers spending any amount of time in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “The rudest man in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: ernsmum
Reviews.Content: The guy who is the bellman/shuttle driver during the day has to be the worst possible advert for this hotel! We were on the so-called shuttle (totally agree with the comments in the previous post about availability) when he shouted out 'Do you have your ID with you?'. We asked him why we needed it (we were only going Downtown!) and all he did was yell at us to answer his question. We only discovered later in the journey that the ID query was to do with the fact we were dropping people off at a Navy base. That was the first and last time we had anything to do with the shuttle as it runs for the hotel's convenience, not the guests. Add to that the fact that the bellmen who organises the pick-ups is also the driver and you'll see that he's not actually around at the hotel very often. Our idea of a shuttle is that it takes guests where and when they desire (within reason, of course). Definitley mislead by the hotel's website on that one. Having said that, the rest of our week's stay was fine. Terri, our waitress in Pam Pam, was excellent and by far the best person we met at the hotel. Shuttle-man could learn a lot from her!

Reviews.Title: “Not such a great stay”
Reviews.Author: ryanpeg
Reviews.Content: I am not as enamored with this hotel as the other reviews. I selected this hotel based on these reviews and I wish I had not. My girl friend and her 2 children and I spent 2 nites at the hotel. First let me say, I do not consider this a hotel but a motel. The room doors all face the parking lot. If I had known this I would not have booked it. The room as clean and everything worked. It did have 2 queen beds that were fairly comfortable. The main problem was the noise. Since the doors face the parking lots, you hear everything. There was screaming and yelling most of Saturday night and running up and down the walkway outside our room. The running shakes everything in the room. I was sure there was going to be a dent or body on my car the next day (there wasn't - but I worried all nite). Sunday, someone was knocking on doors about 9:15pm saying they were from housekeeping and was everything ok. I called the front desk and they argued with me that no one from housekeeping would be doing this.. They finally offered to call security. I also choose not to use the van - although others indicated they will take you wherever you want - when I called, there was a schedule. Yes, they can drop you at the Zoo but only at 9:30 or 10:30 and then they will only pick up at 3:30 or 4:30 - or something like that - Since we had 2 kids with us, we decided to rent a car - i am soooooo glad I did!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!!! More than just clean. Definitely would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Robyn808
Reviews.Content: Hotel was not what I expected.... It was BETTER! First, I have to tell you that I am very picky!!! I don't stay at yucky hotels/motels. I took a chance on this hotel even with a 1 star rating because of all the great reviews on tripadvisor.com. The room at the Days Inn were comparable to the one i saw at the Crowne Plaza. The Days offered 2 queens or 1 King at a rate of $86.00 per night when all the other hotels were offering nothing less than $130-$155.00 per night . The Room is big and the decor was better than I expected. The bathroom was very clean. The amenities I was looking for were FREE parking, FREE High Speed Internet access, and FREE shuttles to the airport and most shopping malls and attractions. Other great amenitites were the hairdryer, iron/board, large refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker in rooms. Since I decided not to rent a car, the shuttles were a significant convenience. The Days Inn is a diamond in the rough!!! I would definitely recommend this property and would stay here again without reservation even if I could spend more for a luxury hotel. Last but not least.... I felt safe staying there alone, which gave me very restful nights during my busy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ninanene
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my daughter and everything it was great! The room was clean and everything we needed. We had some pounding up above one afternoon but we called the front desk and they offered us a differant room or to go and speak to the guests in the room above. I asked them to talk to the guests so I wouldn't have to pack up and move again and we never heard another sound. Don't waste your time on the Pam Pam grill, service was lousy and food was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: seniorfuntraveler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nites. We were very comfortable in our quiet room on the 3rd floor ,which was very spacious with a small kitchenette. We enjoyed the heated pool and jaccuzzi. We were able to walk to a 24 hour family restaurant and convenience store closeby. To our surprize when we asked what bus to take to the attractions they said '"we will sign you up which time do you want to go"? and "we will pick you up." They even one nite drive us down to "Old Town" so we could tour area and have dinner. If you are traveling without a car, this is the place to stay. You are close to public transportation but staff will van you to your point of interest. If you plan to go to San Diego to go to Sea World, Zoo, Old Town, or other attractions this is your hotel. Also they are family friendly, offer AAA discount and other discounts. We stayed for less than $70. a nite. This is a must stay!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pick this hotel for business or leisure travel!!!”
Reviews.Author: BabyNurse87
Reviews.Content: We were in San Diego attending a conference, which was being held at a more expensive hotel across the street. We were a bit wary, considering the 2-2.5 stars that we'd seen for this hotel, but we were SO PLEASANTLY SURPRISED! A complimentary shuttle with a very courteous and informative driver picked us up at the airport...this was the beginning of wonderful service from beginning to end! At check in, we asked to be upgraded to the Business class section of the hotel. For just $10 more per night (still a bargain at ~$90/night for the 4 of us) we got to stay in the tower section, further from the highway and right next to the pool and hot tub (both of which were impeccably clean.) This part of the complex has interior hallways rather than exterior like the rest of the "motel". We also got complimentary bottled water, microwave popcorn and cereal bars. Our room was gorgeous and clean, all marble and cherry wood, with nice colors. Beds were very comfortable with down comforters and soft sheets, extra pillows. Everything was perfectly clean, quiet, and comfortable. Gracious service was the norm from absolutely everyone we met. We took the free shuttle several times, out shopping, to Sea World, etc. At one point we walked to a nearby mall and when we came outside, it had gotten quite dark. We were not sure about walking back in the dark, so we called the front desk and they sent the shuttle to pick us up! This hotel has won "Property of the Year" awards and it is not hard to see why!

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cenny
Reviews.Content: Our stay was okay ,,, The Room was smaller then previous hotel and as we had arranged a rollaway for our son we had to cancel it as there was no way it would fit without us having no spare room .... Our Son and daughter then slept in the Queen Bed and it wasn't too bad !!!! The view from room was nothing to look at , as was a dried up hill... The noise from above when trying to sleep was abit annoying to start with as sounded like a wee heard of elephants but we cranked up the air condition to cover it ... The Air conditioner wasn't working properly to start with but the front desk quickly had that sorted for us ... The hotel is old BUT like any hotel I like to stay in as long as it is clean I am happy with this .. Pool area was ok but lost the sun early because of high trees surrounding this.. Free Shuttle was excellent ,, also the Seven Seas restaurant was prefered over the Pam Pam ...

Reviews.Title: “Disabled Avoid ”
Reviews.Author: olerog
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a motel for the disabled. It is on a hillside ! The reservation was wrong and the staff was rude both the night time and day time. Once I did get a handicapped room the next day it was excellent and very clean. However, I would NOT recommend this property to anyone using a wheelchair

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: ciscokid626_69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Days Inn at Hotel Circle for two nights the weekend of September 14 to celebrate our anniversary. After calling the the hotel's (800) number and asking about they're hotel packages, they hooked us up with a 2-night stay, two (2-day) tickets to Sea World and two Best Value tickets to the San Diego Zoo. Upon arrival to the hotel, we were given our keys to our room and asked if we wanted to set up a time to take the hotel shuttle to the nearby attractions. Our room was clean and extremely comfortable. The hotel's service was excellent and the staff was very friendly. The onsite Pam Pam restaurant serves up some great food (take a sundae to go!) and the shuttles are a great way to get to the attractions. (Just don't miss your shuttle pick up time like we did!) I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CanadianSoldier114
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively, and let me say that I have never been checked in so fast. Granted, we arrived just after midnight, but I was in and out in under two minutes, which was awesome considering I had a wife and two kids waiting in the car, waiting to collapse after a long day of travel. This hotel is definitely good value for your money. We paid $76.50US + tax per night for the AAA rate, and that is absolutely fair value. Make no mistake, this is not a five star hotel, so if that's what you're accustomed to, then don't go to this Days Inn, or you'll only feel the need to write an unfair review, as some others clearly did. The hotel is older, but the owners have clearly done what they can with the place. The pool and hot tub are small but decent, and they provide towels on the spot. The beds are Queen sized and comfortable, although a bit soft for my liking. Standard room came with hairdryer, coffee maker, iron and board and electronic safe. I had to call the front desk once after my son goofed up the safe, just as we were ready to go one morning, and a guy was there within five minutes to fix it. Location is outstanding, assuming you have a car. When I Google Mapped the area, the freeways looked like a plate of spaghetti, but the exits are very well marked and the hotel is very conveniently situated for all San Diego tourist attractions. It's about 15 mins to Petco Park, 10 mins to Seaworld and Balboa Park/Zoo, 5 mins to Old Town. If I were ever to go back, I would definitely stay here again. Only complaint is that there is no breakfast offered, while everywhere else seems to have at least a continental, if not a buffet, but that is reflected in the price. There's a reason this hotel is listed as #45 of 225 in San Diego. Ignore the hotel snobs - if you normally stay in places like Comfort Inn, Travelodge or Holiday Inn, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: CalifSue
Reviews.Content: We were really expecting the worst. We did not want to spend a fortune on a room while moving our boys to school. We felt safe, parking fine, room nice for a 2 star hotel, and the staff very friendly and willing to answer questions about food, etc. no problem. I have booked two more stays in the next couple months. Only thing I didn't like is that if you decide to cancel, you must do so 72 hrs in advance it seems.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right.”
Reviews.Author: Suzapalooza
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night we are a family of four . The staff was nice and gave us a coutesy call to see if we were happy with our room. The beds are comfortable lots of pillows and the room was clean. It had a microwave, refrigerator, efficiency stove, pots and pans. The bath tub was a nice size which I appreciated after a long day at the beach. We were able to park our car right in front of our room which gave us some piece of mind and made unloading easy. Easy access to the 8 and a conveniant distance to Sea World and Mission Beach A continental breakfast would be a nice addition and the parking lot can get a bit noisey late at night but it was a good choice and a great room for the money. I would stay here again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: wickedZ
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel (and tripadvisor reviewers - thanks again). We had 2 rooms for Aug 2,3,4. Rooms included fridge, microwave, iron & board, free wi-fi in room, plenty of pillows, plent of towels. The staff is VERY nice, called within an hour of check-in to make sure our rooms were fine and to see if we needed anything else to make our stay better. We were able to buy tickets for Sea World, San Diego Zoo, and San Diego Wild animal park here- the tickets were discounted and included extras (Heart of Africa Bus tour, Bus tour at the zoo etc..). Free shuttle to Sea World and the Zoo (airport too) - book as soon as you get there since it fills up - the bus drivers are wonderful and even gave my husband a second unscheduled ride when I forgot our Sea World tickets at the hotel. Overall a great deal and if we are ever in the area again this is where we will stay. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone Only cons: rooms smelled a little musty but cleared out with an open window and the AC on - it was very humid and hot during our stay. Tiny bit of mold on one of the drapes in 1 room - I am sure they would have taken care of this had we brought it to their attention and I only mention it because it seems people are bothered more by this now-a-days. We did seem to have a herd of elephants staying over us for all 3 days but this was not the hotles fault - next time I will ask for a 3rd floor room. PS. If you have kids try to control them a little and not have them running and stomping around at 6:30am !! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Friendly service and family friendly”
Reviews.Author: dreijerss
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we were welcomed and given keys straight away to a room next to an elevator, which we thought would help seeing as we have an 18 month year old son. However, as we sat there in the room we soon noticed that the elevator was kind of annoying. After about half an hour we received a call from the front desk, checking that everything was ok. We mentioned that the room was a little noisy,..so we were moved straight away to a much quieter room! The room was perfect with fridge and microwave. The pool was never really busy, perhaps we just happened to turn up at the best time! The jacuzzi was gorgeously warm and my son just loved it! The staff were always very helpful and would give directions to anywhere. We did eat at the restaurant 'Pam Pam' and were not overjoyed at the food, but it got us by for the odd day. We stayed at this hotel for 10 days, so we really did get a real taste of the place. I would go back there again, great location for getting to all the main attractions an San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: toojays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights. hotel located in hotel circle. locaton is great, unlike the Crowne Plaza, there is no traffic when you need to get in and out of the hotel, parking and wireless internet is free. There is a PC with internet with a printer in the lobby you can use for free, you can buy tickets online and print to save some money. Some hotel charge $1 a page to use their printer. Staff were very nice. Very close to two malls, theater, Target, fast food and regular restaurant. I-8 and I-5 it only minutes away unless you hit traffic. Room is clean and carpet is dark, so I don't know if it's clean or not, but I think it's pretty good. Fridge and microwave are a nice touch. I stayed on the third floor so I don't have to worry about people jumping on my ceiling. evening though it was high 70s and sunny outside, the room is nice and cool. Our air conditioner cool the room down pretty good. Bed, towels and overall conditons is nice. Ice machine is a bit far way down stairs, parking space is very tight. Door noise could be a problem if you neighbour is careless, seems like the only way to close the door is to slam shut. This no Hyatt or Double Tree, but with the money I saved and only a place to sleep, I will be back if I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Nice”
Reviews.Author: hobbit99
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn Hotel Circle was a great hotel for the 5 nights my son and I stayed there. It was very close to the Fashion Valley Mall and trolley stop (less than 0.5 mi). The pool was very nice when not filled with noisy kids and the setting was very tropical and relaxing. A nice touch was finding pool towels placed on the pool lounges; it seemed like the hotel was inviting you to the pool. The Pam Pam restaurant had good food (only ate breakfast) but it would have been nice if the Days Inn had a free breakfast bar. A previous commenter suggested upgrading the standard room to the "Business" room, which we did. It was only about $10 more per night and included slightly better bedding (I know it was slightly better because we stayed in a standard room for one night at the end of our vacation and I was able to compare the two room types), complimentary bottled water, granola bars, and micro-wave popcorn, and it had the added benefit of being in a totally separate building (near the pool) with interior hallway and doors. This definitely made the rooms quieter. Also, if timing was right, there was covered parking which definitely helps keep the car cool. There was easy access to I-8 and Rt 163 so getting to town only took a couple minutes. There were many other hotels near this one so keep that in mind if there are no rooms available when you try to book.

Reviews.Title: “Was very surprise from reviews!”
Reviews.Author: C8
Reviews.Content: June 26, 2007 for 3 nights (1 adult/2children). Was very surprise upon arrival. Took Amtrak from Los Angeles; shuttle pickup was excellent and timely. The hotel site is next to many hotels, restaurants, convenience store and bus lines. Use the shuttle to Sea World and Zoo. You must book on arrival because they due fill up. Requested our rooms near the pool which is in a new area with elevator. Room was spacious, with microwave, frig, and great beds with lots of pillows. Pool area was nice but crowded because everyone arrived after the activities; provided pool towels. Tried the restaurant on site which was good and crowded. When ordering from the children's menu, they shared; so much food. Overall, our stay was very good. They provided bottle water, popcorn, health bars free (business class rooms). Lots of good towels and service was A!!! and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great for price!”
Reviews.Author: florca
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised. We decided to save money by not renting a car and try out their free shuttle. We were impressed by this service. They picked us up, took us to Sea World and the San Diego Zoo, plus to dinner in Old Town-- all free and on time. We had been planning on spending over 200 dollars to rent a car and that turned out to be unnecessary. The rooms were fine. Nothing special, but we did request (and receive) a microwave and fridge. The pool was very nice. I usually don't swim while on vacation, but the water was very warm, the setting was tropical and clean. We found the staff to be very nice. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Hotel Circle San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Connie5745
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Days Inn - Hotel Circle from June 8 - 16th. Was very impressed with room and location. Perfect for getting anywhere. Room was nice - adequate for our needs and was pleasantly surprised by the pool area during quiet times. When it was full of kids was hard to swim as pool not very big. Very clean and well kept. Always staff around cleaning. Pam Pam Grill was very expensive and service was slow. Went there first day for breakfast, was charged $23.00 for 2 people and didn't go back all week. Otherwise pleasant stay and the room looked like what it showed in the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Sunny:)620
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and while it is a nice hotel, you really need a car to get around. There was a mall nearby, but you had to cross under a freeway, and walk through another hotel parking lot to get there, but that was also where the bus, and train depot was. The shuttle from the Amtrak station was convienient, but we didn't realize that the shuttles to Seaworld and the Zoo only ran twice a day so we ended up getting suck with the shuttle to the zoo at that left at 11, and returned at 2. We decided to take a taxi instead because otherwise we'd only have 3 hours, and it ended up costing us $30 because the taxi driver literally took us for a ride (it should have only taken 5 minutes). There's no contiental breakfast, and no grocery stores around, only a liquor mart where the prices are ridiculous. Finally one of the guys at the front desk offered to drive us to a grocery store because he was taking another guy there, and we all ended up sharing a cab back because he didn't show up to pick us up afterwards. The internet access was good, if you could get on the computer. It is possible to walk to Old Town, and the Gas Lamp Quarter if you don't mind risking your life walking on the freeways.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Sara4339
Reviews.Content: This motel quite possibly had the best customer service I have ever experienced. There were 5 of us in one room and the staff practically bent over backwards to make sure we were comfortable. The shuttle service was excellent and even helped us out traveling to places other then the zoo. The drivers and hotel information desk employees were insightful, helpful, and full of great advice. Although the rooms were a tad bit outdated, for the price I would definitly stay here again. The Metro line and Fashion Valley Mall are about a 5 minute walk away. This is great if you are without a car, as the Metro line will take you to the Gaslamp, Stadium and other great places. Loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: peegee1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in April 2007. Check in was easy. Room was a bit tired but ok for the price. Location not the best unless you have a car although the free shuttles to Zoo and Seaworld were great. Had a problem with toilet blocking on last day. Ok Stay for the price but would proberbly stay elsewere if I returned to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Motel.”
Reviews.Author: uplandtraveller
Reviews.Content: So we read different reviews on this hotel, including the one about a sink falling off and parking nightmares, so we really wondered how it would be when we got there. After checking in, we were anxious to get to the room to see if I needed to to go pay a visit to the front desk to change the room. Two things I noticed right away.......1) plenty of parking (although keep in mind this is a 3 story motel, with motel style parking), but common sense will tell you too that sometimes you might not get the space directly outside of your room. 2) Sink was secure to the wall. Phew!! So after I did the normal checking around the room I determined it was very clean and tidy. I did not find anything wrong. We used the pool in which was very clean and at the back of the property away from the street and you needed your room key to get in. A secure pool area. The onsite restuarant was convenient for the one night a meal and a couple of beers in the room was in order. I would come back and stay at this hotel, although price shop around on the hotel circle as all the hotels are right in one area and next door to each other. In my case I am a triprewards member so I wanted to stay in a property with rewards. If you are looking for a motel, then this has what you expect with additional perks of a microwave, fridge, coffee pot, iron, iron board, shampoos, lotions, soaps etc. and the "distressed travellers kit" which are the complimentary forgotten items like toothpaste, mouthwash, toothbrush, shaving items, all for just asking at the front desk. If this hotel comes up with a tempting price, consider.

Reviews.Title: “Pack your earplugs”
Reviews.Author: 40ish
Reviews.Content: We found the room at Days Inn far too small for a family of four. The room smellled very musty. Both the sink and bath plugs didn't work. Would stay some where else next time

Reviews.Title: “Dirty motel at hotel prices”
Reviews.Author: Ca_hols1
Reviews.Content: Given the glowing Tripadvisor reviews and the fact that the hotel was Day's Inn property of the year 2006, we were expecting the Days Inn to at least be clean. That it wasn't! You could write your name on the top of the microwave or fridge in the layer of dust and the bathroom had peeling paint and black mould on the walls and something even nastier smeared on the sliding bathroom door. The sink had partly fallen off the wall and was at a strange angle having been bodged up with mastic and the sink looked like it had been cleaned at least once in the last 10 years. It was also obvious that the carpet hadn't been vacuumed for a while as food from the previous guest stuck to my feet. By far the worse thing was the noise from the I-8 highway directly opposite through the badly fitted windows. It would have been easier to sleep on the shoulder of the highway than in this Days Inn. All in all this just a cheap motel charging hotel prices, and Motel 6 down the road offers much better value. Only in San Diego would they be able to get away with this! When we checked out we were expecting someone at least to ask "how was your stay" but they never did, so that seemed to imply the staff really weren't interested in their guest's experience.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: PinkFlamingoAltoona
Reviews.Content: My college-aged daughter and I spent 5 nights at the hotel and it was a fairly pleasant stay. Simple rooms but were pleased with having a microwave and small fridge. About 5 minutes after we got into our room, guest services called to make sure that everything was in order. I've stayed in a much more expensive hotels in the past and never received a call like that! I was impressed. The heated pool was sparkling clean. The hot tub/spa was in need of maintenance the first night - closed the 2nd night (probably for cleaning!) - but very clean (although extremely hot) the remaining nights. A shuttle is available to local areas (airport, Mission Beach, etc.) but cannot be counted on at exact times when in high demand. We took the shuttle to Mission Beach but were unable to take the shuttle back at the time we wanted, so we had to take a cab back. (Note: the cab cost about $20 with tip.) Most of the staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. Offering a continental breakfast would have been nice but there is a cafe (Pam Pam Cafe - American Fare foods) which was ok. The noise from the room above us was loud at times - not very good insulation. But didn't hear much from the rooms on the sides. It is in a location convenient to many areas/highways which was nice. But beautiful San Diego views are non-existent. It's in a very commercial area close to many other hotels. It is a good location if you do not plan to lounge at the hotel and go sight-seeing. I would have preferred staying closer to a beach - but didn't want to pay the extra money. Not on this trip, at least. My overall opinion is that it was fine for this trip - and would recommend it to someone looking for an affordable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: nocturnalgirl72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights..the night before we flew out to Hawaii and one night when we returned. We actually had 6 people and a toddler but since we were in the room for less than 12 hours each stay, we did not mind the cramped quarters. We did the snooze and cruise so the hotel allowed us to leave both our cars at the hotel for the snooze and cruise price which was about $20.00 more than the regular AAA rate of about $89.00 so it made it $109.00. That was a deal and it saved us a fortune on parking. Check in was fast and pleasant. Small lobby with a computer with internet for guests to use. Room was nice size...2 double beds, TV with cable, coffee maker. We had 2 people in each bed and a crib in between them and 2 people on the floor and still room to walk around and room for all of our luggage. They have a shuttle bus that takes you to and from the airport (about 7 or 8 miles away) and Seaworld (only a mile or 2 away). The shuttle bus stops running at 10pm which sucked for us on the return since we had 6 people with bags so we got totally ripped off by Sea-top Shuttle which charged us 10.00 per person for a 10 minute ride. It would have been cheaper for us to take 2 cabs, even 3 but my husband did not want to wait. When you have a group of people, a cab is cheaper since they are not per person. I argued with the driver that I thought his price was too high since we had 6 adults and he told me by the time I hire 2 or 3 cabs it would be the same. We should have just taken a cab anyways. Our return room had a nice kitchenette in it with small fridge and microwave. the next morning though was noisy and we kept hearing alot of loud people outside our door. I understand this hotel has inside corridor rooms like a hotel does but we did not see these, we didnt care since we were only in the hotel for a very short time. Check out was fast and easy. I have always like Days Inn hotels and this one does not disappoint. Highly recommended especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kitchenette”
Reviews.Author: Michelle B
Reviews.Content: We had two small children at the time, and having the kitchenette was wonderful. It is a busy hotel with one pool which is quite a walk away from your room. It is in a busy location, but overall it isn't bad.

Reviews.Title: “The cleanest hotel I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: English-kara
Reviews.Content: The room smelt great and on closer inspection there was NOT a trace of dirt or grime insight. The staff were extremely helpfull in letting us borrow screwdrivers to assemble products that we bought to helping us with our travel, Which was much needed as we had never been to San Diego before. I was expecting to stay in a dump as we have stayed in many low budget hotels across the states and was pleasently surprised the onsight diner is a must especially the belgium waffles. Mission valley mall is a short walk which was great for me proberly not so great for my husband though.

Reviews.Title: “Homey Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LadyElaine24
Reviews.Content: I went to college in San Diego and visit annually to catch up with my former roomates. I wanted a safe, quiet, clean place to stay that was central and close to the freeway. Mission Valley seemed the most convenient for this purpose. After seeing a lower price for the Days Inn advertised on Travelocity, I called the hotel and spoke to a friendly and helpful young woman named Ingrid, who matched the rate. This was a good omen of things to come. For about $75 a night, I was upgraded to an inviting business room in the hotel's newer Sunset wing. In addition to a comfortable king bed, blackout curtains, microwave, refrigerator, coffeemaker, hairdryer, light-up magnifying mirror and good-sized TV, the clean and well-furnished room was graced with many welcoming touches, including complimentary bottled water, snacks and toiletries. There was ample counter space and no shortage of places to sit and relax. I was pleased that the building offered covered parking for my car, and never had a problem locating a spot - though the hotel was nearly full with post-Christmas guests. I didn't use the jacuzzi or pool, but a number of guests appeared to enjoy the nicely landscaped pool area. The location was great -- close to the I-8 freeway and Fashion Valley's shops, restaurants and movie theaters. I enjoyed my meals at Gordon Biersch and Sammy's Wood-fired Pizza. A few quibbles: the building desperately lacks adequate insulation. Every time someone shut a door, my room reverberated. No joke. I could also hear people talking in the hallway, walking above me and traipsing up/down the stairwell. When my upstairs neighbor turned on their shower faucet, it sounded like a flood threatened to deluge my ceiling at any minute. Bring your earplugs. The towels were a bit scratchy and not very plush, but they certainly gave me a lot of them. For the price, I felt I received my money's worth and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: kimbo66
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel. We got it for a bargain and wow were we suprized by the value for money we got. Rooms were great, beautifully decorated and so spacious. All amenities provided and great plunge coffee too. Bathrooms good and great shower which was nice. Internet access provided for free and saved us quite a lot as we used it many times. Laundry area was good with TV and video games to pass the time. Ice machines provided free of charge and vending machines near all rooms. Car parking was also free of charge. It is however a little out of the way, but if you have a car, it is the best choice for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, typical Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: OhioChowhound
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in this hotel as part of a wedding party. The location is great - close to zoo, beach, Sea World, and Old Town. This is a motel-style place, with doors that open to the parking lot, so we had a lot of road noise coming into our first-floor room. Cleaning service was a bit slow - they didn't clean our room until after 4:00 pm, but service was basically fine. The room is typical Days Inn - not fancy and kind of dark, but seemed clean and the price was good. If I stayed in this area again, I would price the Holiday Inn next door because it seemed newer and nicer. This is a decent place to stay but don't expect it to be anything but a typical Days Inn, even if it is their "hotel of the year".

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn - Hotel Circle, San Diego, CA”
Reviews.Author: Hallsy55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in June. After we made a phone call to the hotel from the airport, a driver from the hotel picked us up at the airport within a short period of time (15 minutes?) Check in was quick and easy. Our room was on the 2nd floor accessible by an elevator, but it was quicker to take the stairs. The room was your average Days Inn room - 2 queen size beds, full bath, tv and enough storage space. We did like having the small refrigerator in the room. As we were visiting relatives in San Diego, we did not rent a car, however, if you are staying here for vacation without knowing someone there, I would strongly suggest getting a rental. There was trolley and bus service right in front of the hotel. We used the trolley to go to the waterfront. The hotel offered transportation to the San Diego Zoo/Balboa Park which we used. It worked out very well - on time and no problems. There is also service to Sea World but we didn't stay long enough to go there. After a day out, we wanted to go to Old Towne for dinner and called the front desk for a taxi recommendation. As the hotel driver was not busy he took us downtown! He told us to call the hotel when we were done, and he would pick us up where he dropped us off. We tipped him for his time. Our room was always neat and clean. There is a small restaurant on the site which served good food at reasonable prices. Nothing real fancy. I think we were in San Diego the only week of the year that it wasn't warm and sunny! We scouted out the pool but never went swimming. Looked nice enough. There was also a hot tub outdoors. There are no stores within walking distance so if you want snacks for the room get them while you are out and about. There was one small convenience/package store that we found, but as all convenience stores, it was overpriced and not a big selection. The day before our return trip, we checked with the driver for a trip back to the airport. When we were ready to leave the next day, we checked out and the driver had our bags loaded and off we went. All in all the hotel was good for a week long stay, but what made it above average was the staff - always accommodating and helpful. I would recommend staying at the Days Inn - Hotel Circle. It's not 5 star, but it doesn't pretend to be. Comfortable and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very affordable, comfortable, nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Buddynutnut
Reviews.Content: Stayed on 11/17/06 for just one night at $99. It was a King size bed room and had the standard fair for the price. A quick pro and cons. Pros: -Room was clean. -Staff courtegous. Gave a courtesy call to the room to make sure the room was to our satisfaction. -Easy access to the freeway. -Free Parking. Cons: - Can be noisy if someone is running around outside. Room "can" be a factor. For the price, it's pretty good... it would have been great if it was in the 70-80 range. Expect lots of families in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Accommodations & Value”
Reviews.Author: BurkePL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5+ day trip to San Diego. Stayed at this hotel following a friend's recommendation. Was assigned an upper floor room (away from the street), with two queen beds. We were pleased with the accommodations, level of service, and cost for our stay. The motel is close to major highways, with ease of access to downtown, Old Town, Balboa Park, and the beaches. While not an upscale establishment, the motel was definitely above average for the cost of our stay. Also of note, the on-site cafe, the Pam Pam Cafe & Grill, served a very good breakfast at a very reasonable cost; we ate there four mornings. Overall, we were pleased with our stay, and would come back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Asthma Attack!!”
Reviews.Author: 2bamboo
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel because it was the only one I could find, at a decent rate, that had a kitchenette, for our week long stay in San Diego. With a family of five, eating in is a must. We carried our ice chest and bags of groceries in to the room to find that the "kitchenette" was not only located in the bathroom area but had a sink the size of a coffee mug, a microwave resembling something in a Barbie dreamhouse (that did not work) and two small burners, only of which one worked....sometimes. The mini-fridge was mostly iced over and would not even fit our milk. Disappointed but undaunted, we unpacked and squeezed in. There was very little walking room between the beds and the TV cabinet, no room between the beds and the walls and minimum room between the beds. The window did not open so we listened to the room fan all night long. Each time someone walked by on the walkway outside the whole room shook. In the middle of the night my son had his first asthma attack in three years. As I attempted to comfort him I noticed that my throat was sore and my eyes were watering. My husband started coughing and my daughters said they had headaches. I complained to the front desk in the morning and they offered to re-clean the room but I declined because I think it was the cleaning products that were part of the problem. The room had a strange odor from the start. We had to find another place to stay. The staff was apologetic and friendly, my problem was AAA. I did not purchase trip insurance and they refused to refund my pre-payment. Long story: I eventually worked it out and luckily found a fabulous Hotel, with a full sized kitchen, plenty of space, a private bedroom and a great location for $50 a night more. Money well spent in my opinion. They laughed when I told them where we were staying and offered me a discount. Continuing to stay at the Days Inn would have tainted our entire vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: amm2531
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Days Inn for one night, but I wish it could've been longer. I'm from Pennsylvania and on our vacation to San Diego, we stayed at 3 different hotels. They were rated 3 and 3 1/2 stars. This Days Inn should be rated higher. The room was very modern and updated. It was very clean and affordable! We had a nice little microwave and refrigerator. We had a complimentary shuttle to the airport as well! I'd definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: Caroline23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two of my girlfriends doing an American travel thing. We arrived late but were upgranded to business class and whenever we needed to find out were to go or needed a lift by the local tourist guide there was no problem. They were very friendly and the pool area was nice and jacuzi even nicer, wasnt complete luxury but very comfortable. Very much enjoyed my stay. the only downside was it was abit far from the main town but only a walk to the shopping centre so that was good :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the Budget-Minded Weekend Stay-er!”
Reviews.Author: atravelbugbitme
Reviews.Content: PROS: •Good price; •LOCATION!!! Close to all major interstate and intrastate highways; Centrally located to most sights, mall, gas station mini-mart; 0-10 minute drive to all; •Staff very courteous, friendly, helpful and accommodating—even allowed us to check in early and heated our dinners with no problem! •Room amenities were average, but in good condition (iron kinda ghetto, bring your own); great: mini refrigerator w/freezer in room (we really needed that); add a microwave and the room would be perfect; •Bed surprisingly comfy for a motel; •Room very clean and quiet; It's an older facility, but no weird/musty/moldy odors; the carpets, linens, drapes, furniture are in good, clean condition; it's obvious they take care of the facility; •Black-out drapes (I always secretly thought my mom was a chicken--up at the crack of dawn; with the black-out drapes she didn't rise until 11am); •Ice/soda machines on every corner of the buildings; CONS: •Parking spaces too small; Couldn't get in/out of car; •No microwave in room; •Wasn't impressed with PAM-PAM café; lunch was pricey for what we ordered; should allow more time for late breakfast eaters; NIT-PICKING: •Air conditioning slightly drones (I loved it—gotta have background noise, roommates hated it); •The alarm on the clock didn't go off—my watch, and two cell phone alarms did--and boy did I hate all THAT noise); •An Aussie patron walking around outside in his too-small skivvies talking on a cell phone—eww; he was friendly though… TIPS: •Take advantage of the attraction deals at the motel; •Rent a car; spontaneity is a blessing; •Get outside of your comfort zone and experience come of the AMAZING local ethnic restaurants—no major chains and all of those traps in the Tourist Districts (Gaslight, Downtown) don't count; here's a hint: Cheryl's Soul Food Deli in the 'hood—it's a gem. •Talk to locals; they're some of the friendliest people on the planet; •Put your helmets, knee and elbow pads on, the drivers in San Diego are no joke!

Reviews.Title: “Moldy bathroom”
Reviews.Author: malbrandj
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 08/30 - 09/02. Upon check in my wife decided to take a bath because we had been to the beach. She went into the bathroom and their was a stripe of Mold about 3 inches wide all around the shower area. There was also mold on the ceiling and the fixtures as well as the floor of the tub. They had their staff come and clean the walls and ceiling, but left the fixtures and floor of the tub moldy. What we got in return was a breakfast at the Pam Pam Cafe (very good quick service) and a basket of candy. For an average price of $98 per night, I would have expected the room to at least be clean. I for one will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget accommodations”
Reviews.Author: cmilitel
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here August 19-24. This property was exactly as advertised - a cheap, clean budget hotel with few frills. The location was good; nothing was more than a 20 minute ride from the hotel. Note to those not already familiar with San Diego: Hotel Circle, where this property is located, is a road that runs about 5 miles on either side of the I-8 freeway. There are few restaurants on this strip and fewer places to purchase groceries/supplies. It is easy to reach these things from Hotel Circle if you have a car, but if not, your choices are very limited. The room itself was adequately-sized and contained a small kitchenette (two burners, a microwave, small fridge and some dishes and silverware). The room had a pretty funky odor upon arrival, but I stopped noticing the smell after a day or two (the rest of my family did not and complained about it throughout the stay). Otherwise, things were clean and reasonably comfortable. Another nice plus was the free internet access. Even if you do not bring your own laptop, the front desk area has a computer for guest use. This came in handy for making online reservations, getting directions, checking e-mail, etc. The staff was friendly and accommodating and took care of nearly every request we made. One final caveat: parking here is very limited. If you return to the hotel past 9:00 pm, you may have great difficulty in finding a parking space, especially if you have a car larger than a compact. This was the one place where the staff was less than helpful; probably because they just don't have the space. Overall, we got what we paid for. We paid about $88/night after contacting the hotel directly.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: J&CGARDNER
Reviews.Content: We are two ladies, (one a 75 year old) and we looked long and hard at the advice which was given for this motel. Having no transport, location was of prime importance and it was with some trepidation that we picked the Days Inn. We did not need to have worried at all. Every morning, bright and early, we had a most enjoyable short walk from the motel through the Town and Country Resort and had the choice of either the bus or trolley to almost anywhere. There was a multitude of eating places in the immediate vicinity as all hotels have restaurants open to non-residents and a small mini mart nearby. We arrived just before midnight and were very pleasantly surprised that even at this late hour they had taken account of our request for a 3rd floor room at the back of the motel. The desk staff were consistently friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. As mentioned the shuttle drivers were smart, prompt and very helpful. The room was large (two queen sized beds), clean and quiet. The beds were oh! so comfortable after long days - well equipped with iron/board, hairdrier, coffee maker, fridge, high standard toiletries and plenty of lovely fluffy white towels. Excellent, efficient maid service. The heated pool and hot tub were spotlessly clean and there were plenty of towels, tables and chairs, the best bonus being its tranquility and the beauty of the surroundings which we thought was quite an achievement for a motel in this location. All-in-all you will by now have realised that we were thoroughly satisfied with our 8 night stay and the value for money. We can't wait to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location!”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_Okanagan
Reviews.Content: We just returned home after spending 3 nights in San Diego at the Days Inn-Hotel Circle. The location was central to everything we wanted to do and so easy to find. The motel is older but seemed to be kept in nice shape from the grounds to the building itself. We found the staff to be very friendly and went out of their way to accomodate our two families by placing our rooms next to each other. We appreciated the easy-to-follow maps with excellent directions to many attractions around the area. Our rooms were clean, but ours had a slight musty smell, while the other one was just fine. This wasn't a big deal as we didn't spend much time there anyway. We did notice some noise from people above us and outside the walkway, but we expected that from an older motel. Our rooms had a small fridge which worked out so well for us for milk and other beverages. The motel offers a complimentary shuttle to a few attractions but since we had a van, we didn't use it. We were told though that people must reserve a spot the day before to secure a spot. The pool was a nice retreat after a long day of sightseeing. There were lots of towels and chairs to use, even though the pool seemed always busy. If you are looking for a good place to stay on a budget, this economy motel is worthwhile to check out. We were pleased that even though the motel is rated at 2 stars, we got a good value for our money. We will definitely stay here again, and will recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Budget wise lodging for family”
Reviews.Author: azmrse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Days Inn/Hotel Circle from June 11-15, 2006. It was a choice based on budget and safety. We got a great room with frig and microwave, nice TV, and clean! Their pool was a family oasis in the back of the property with tall trees around and locking gate. I saw families having a great time. It was close to a street which we discovered was a back road into San Diego without getting back on freeways. We bought discounted Sea World tickets at front desk and rode the motel van to and from for no cost. The trolley had a pick up in front but we did not use it as we had a car. I suggest the Business class rooms in the back by the pool if you want quiet and privacy. It was a great place for $69 a night. Look for deals online and through your work place.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: yesmanHawaii
Reviews.Content: We are from Hawaii. We just got back from San Diego. We were experiencing the June Gloom month, everything was cool and overcast with gray skies. Not good. Anyway we stayed at this hotel. It was totally worth it! We are not used to staying at an Inn, only hotels. So we expected the worst. But it was actually a very, very good stay. The place is very well up kept and the staff are very helpful and friendly. We requested to stay in the new section called the “sunset” something. This newer part is very nice, mostly everything is renovated in there. The bathrooms are very nice and the beds are very soft and clean. The rooms are very quiet and the pool is clean and heated. There are a lot of people there, the rooms were mostly full. Overall I would highly recommend families to stay there, but request for the new section. Also what was best is that it is very close to malls, old town and the freeway. Very good location! The food around the area is also very good. I would definitely stay there again. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here. Not bad, especially for $80 night. Room was quite clean, although I did find an old french-fry under the bed while searching for an outlet for my cell-phone charger. Place is rather grungey on outside. It could use a really thorough pressure-wash. But parking lot fairly clean, with plenty of spaces. Front desk upon check-in very friendly and polite. Set me up in no time. Nice colorTV and good selection of local and cable channels, including all 3 news channels. Bathroom very clean. Good reliable room service every monring. Very convenient to SeaWorld; Point Loma and all sorts of shopping quite nearby. Adjacent to Interstate 8, so easy on/off; just make sure you get in the right lane or you'll need to make a two-mile lloop!. Overall, not bad, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with great value for money. Near all local attractions. Pool good (although it wasnt fully heated when we went) Restaraunt staff not at all helpful, but all other staff were friendly. Great Value, good for families etc

Reviews.Title: “Nice For The Price !!”
Reviews.Author: LovePuertoVallarta
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate for 2 nights here... about $75 with all the taxes... per night. Hotel was very clean. Staff friendly and helpful. The shuttle drivers were on time, and very very courteous!! We rode the shuttle to the zoo even though we wanted to visit Balboa Park. When the shuttle driver overheard us talking about it, he drove us to the main entrance at Balboa Park-- which is not a scheduled stop for them. Rooms were very spacious. We had everything we needed. Shampoos, etc were a nicer quality than most.My husband has trouble walking, and we were given a 3rd floor room.... but right next to the elevator.... so it was very convenient. A few things could use some improvement: (1) Luggage... we waited over 30 minutes for help with the luggage and the shuttle driver had to wait, also. Finally carried most of it down ourselves.... and the guy showed up. (2) The bathroom door was VERY annoying!! It was a sliding door, and hard to close. It squeaked badly... was very very hard to close (heavy), and woke my husband if I used the bathroom during the night. (3) Ice machines are inconvenient. It was still a pleasant experience, and a good value. I would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth just under $99 a night...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was not very friendly and didn't tell us we had to "reserve" a spot on the shuttle and the shuttle driver said he would not go to SeaWorld?... Rooms very basic, loved the king size bed, but it stank pretty bad when we came in. Overall Just like the title. I wouldn't spend over $100 a night here. P.S.- Call the hotel, they have better rates and availability.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay with a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Days Inn in February 2006. The staff was friendly and helpful. Location excellent for what we wanted to see in the short time we were in San Diego. Shuttle service on time and friendly drivers. Room was perfect and the restuarant had a good choice of food and good service. All reasonable priced and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: sarahdsmom
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend in San Diego and we loved our stay at the Days Inn in Hotel Cirlce. This Hotel is in the Mission Valley Area. Just a short drive to beaches, shopping, and downtown. We've lived in San Diego and stayed in San Diego at other area hotels and for the value, quality and convience it can't be beat. It was clean, the staff very helpful. It is just off the freeway (like all the hotels in the area), we just got a room on the 3rd floor (top) near the back and noise wasn't a problem at all. A beautiful heated pool and spa with towels available. The rooms look newly remodeled. The small Pam Pam Cafe' located at the hotel is a nice place for a late dinner or early breakfast. Great menu, service and terrific food. I can't say enough about this place. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Non Driver”
Reviews.Author: willie078
Reviews.Content: we have just returned to the UK after spending 14 nights at the abovel hotel. As I do not drive during my visits to the united states this hotel was a great location for us . The MTA No.6 bus took you from outside the hotel to Fashion Valley Transit/Mall with access to the Trolly Green Line and return to the hotel using the MTA No.25 or 41 or the No.6 from Oldtown Area all stop outside the hotel reception area. Should you want to walk its a 10 minute walk to the mall/transit area. The hotel provided a first class service and also provide free transport to and from the airport.All staff were very helpful. For anyone coming over from the UK relax and let the Metropolition Transit System do the driving and keep onto your no claims discount.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Helpful Service”
Reviews.Author: active retiree Tennessee
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Diego for an afternoon and evening, then one full day, and then the next day we left on a cruise. A real plus was the availability of van service which we used extensively being picked up at the airport, that first night to Old Town, the next day to the zoo, and the next to the cruise ship. Our room was clean, pleasant, comfortable. Clean room, comfortable beds, plenty of hot water, excellent desk staff, informative van drivers. A real pleasant stay!

HotelInfo.Name: Days Hotel Circle by SeaWorld
HotelInfo.Address: 543 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
